description:
My FAVORITE go-to burrito and quesadilla spot. I eat here at least once a month. I've tried other places in SF for burritos but this is definitely the most tasty for me! I have never been more confident in giving a 5 star. 

Burritos: meat so fresh and juicy, perfect slightly crunchy wrap, avocado freshly scooped (you'll see them making it for you), sour cream to complement the taste

Quesadilla: cheesy so good that the cheese stretches with your bite, steak inside the quesadilla is a literal strip of deliciousness. 

We also get the chips on the side while waiting for our order. 

Service: despite having so many customers they're willing to make special adjustments for us like putting any sauces on the side. There is water and plenty of napkins available. The food is also brought to you if you dine in! 

The restaurant has a nice vibe, sometimes with musicians walking up and down the aisles. Even though the line seems long it passes by quickly!
author: Yvette Y.

description:
The Pros:
Forget La Taqueria! El Farolito is THE place to go! Got the super carne asada quesadilla and HOLY CRAP it was AMAZING. On the contrary, everything I've tried at Taqueria was really bland and unseasoned. I paid around nine dollars for my supersized quesadilla which is on the expensive end, but it was so huge and filling (and delicious) that it was totally worth it. The meat was super tender and well seasoned. Had a touch of heat and generous amount of flavor. Quesadilla was lightly toasted and crisp. Try all the sauces at the bar for multiple flavor combinations! I'm writing this review a couple of days after and I'm honestly salivating. 

Some cons: 
My quesadilla was cut into halves and stacked. By the time I finished the first half, the bottom half was soaked in grease / sauces. The quesadilla wasn't crisp anymore and it was too soggy to pick up, so I had to go grab a fork. On that note, it's EXTREMELY greasy. I could feel a coat of oil on my throat after I finished eating. But hey, if you're going to indulge in an amazing quesadilla, it better be greasy as hell :) Seating was also very dirty, limited, and crowded. Five stars for the food, one star for hygiene.
author: Shirley C.

description:
Great tasting but pricy tacos.

I ordered the lengua, carne asada, and al pastor soft tacos. The lengua was my favorite and was super tender. The carne asada was a bit dry and flavorless. And the al pastor was pretty traditional in it seasoning. They give a good amount of onions and cilantro but the sauces are pretty mediocre. 

Overall the tacos are good, but not worth the price at all. At this place I would say the burritos are the way to go. They're filling but will cost you less than 3 tacos. I also really enjoyed the horchata here. A little too sweet but tasted on point. 

The wait sometimes might look intimidating but the line moves pretty fast. There is rarely enough seating, so don't expect to seat a large party here.
author: Eric Q.

description:
The short: wonderful spot

Some places in SF cater to a specific client, excluding a good portion of the community. However, El Farolito caters to all people who just want delicious Mexican food. I noticed people of various ethnicities, various socioeconomic levels, locals and travelers, first-timers and frequent visitors, etc.

I ordered the super quesadilla quiza with beef and everything inside, wrapped in a spinach tortilla. The beef was on the salty side, but I really enjoyed the combination of flavors, abundant ingredients, and the lovely people watching opportunities.

Service is fast and the table turn-over is quite fast too.

The bathroom was surprisingly clean and when I stepped out, I was surprised to find the noise level quite low for the number of people inside.

I wish they would round up their prices to include tax so I don't have to carry change. Additionally, their space could use an update, but I guess it adds to the hole-in-the-wall charm

Verdict: would come back to fulfill a Mexican food craving
author: Catherine W.

description:
CASH ONLY. If you want good and cheap Mexican food, you've come to the right place. My friends and I were hungry after our flight from LA so we decided to try out the 4 star with 4k reviews to see the hype. The hype is real. It seems like people were torn between the super burrito and super quesadilla, so my fiance and I decided to get both. 

I personally liked the asada super burrito better. The al pastor super quesadilla (super suiza) was really good, but I felt like there was just more flavor in the burrito. Top it off with that avocado salsa at the salsa bar. 

There is seating available but it is limited. I feel like this place is packed 24/7. We got here around 5pm and barely beat the rush. By the time we sat down after ordering (literally 10 min later) the line was out the door and continued to stay out the door until we left.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Not the best burrito I have ever had, nor is it the best experience I have had but it was an experience nonetheless. To be honest I didn't have high hopes for this place but the anticipation of waiting in line really made it that much more enjoyable. It's a hole in the wall, and it's dingy. Not much seating is had here but those are the kind of places that whet my pallet. I went with a friend and we split the super burrito with carne. This thing was packed with all sorts of goodness. The meat itself wasn't mind blowing and to be honest it was just okay; didn't seem to have much seasoning to it. But mixed with the piping hot beans and rice really helped to bring out the subtleties of the meat. I loaded my half with a ton of salsa and went to town. The salsa had jalapeño in it so there was some heat going along with everything else. I would definitely eat there again and see what the other meats taste like.
author: John C.

description:
What you need to know: 
- Cash only folks! 
- This joint closes late (2:30am or 3:30am depending on day) 
- Small seating area, not enough for the long lines of people 
- The cashier is very friendly and efficient 
- You walk in, stand in the line and place your order and wait for the cooking staff to call out your number 
- It's right next to the 24th Street BART station, the neighborhood can be a bit dodgy.  
- Has a variety of meats beyond the typical, including: beef head, beef tongue, brain and intestine

What I ordered: 
- Super al pastor burrito $8.25 - The super burrito is merely $1 more and includes sour cream, cheese and a hefty chuck of avocado (get it!). The al pastor was marinated well and came in a nice savory sauce that gelled everything together. The burrito was very generous and was a delight to eat. I asked if they could griddle the burrito, which they did but it wasn't as crispy as I would have preferred. 
Conclusion: it was a solid burrito but wasn't my favorite Mission burrito.  But I will have to come back for their delicious looking quesadillas!
author: Karen L.

description:
Pretty decent taco/burrito place, is it the best I have had, no but its not too bad. I think there`s just a lot of hype for the place. The line is always long and there are plenty of good options if you can`t go in. I got a burrito with lengua (tongue). Really solid but the lengua was okay in terms of flavor (would`ve preferred more kick and taste).

The other meat flavours are decent but nothing to travel for. If you are in the area, check it out, otherwise its fine to skip for all the other great eats in San Francisco. I also come from Texas, so I guess I`ve been spoiled by great Mexican and TexMex food.
author: Taylor Z.

description:
El Farolito is located in the Mission on Mission by 24th St and Bart. There is no parking lot but plenty of metered street parking in the area. 

This is CASH ONLY. Limited and tight seating inside. There's a few tables along the wall by the front entrance but more towards the back. The interior is narrow and can get cramped. There is a limited salsa bar with Medium, Mild and Hot Sauces with to go containers at the end of the register area. 

If you order burritos there are 3 tortilla options of flour, wheat, or spinach. I usually get the Pollo Asado Super Burrito (Rice, Beans, Cheese, Sour Cream, Guacamole, Salsa and Cilantro). If you don't pick any particular beans they will give you regular whole beans. The Burritos are pretty big. All items in the burrito are evenly distributed and they are not skimpy with the meat unlike other spots. What sticks out about El Farolitos too is that oppose to Guacamole they actually put slices of Avocados in the Super Burritos. All items in the burrito were fresh and tasty. The interior was not soaked and wet or mushy. Another go to item is their Quesadilla Suiza (Cheese & Steak). Can't go wrong with either choice.

There is usually a line but don't let the line detour you. The line moves along and they are efficient and fast. During peak hours during the week dinner time might wait 10-15 minutes for your one item order or just call in your order to go to avoid the wait. Make sure to hang on to your ticket order and listen for your number to be called then pick up the order by the cash register.

I definitely recommend El Farlito if you're in the area looking for a good burrito or quesadilla. This is my go to spot whenever I am in the area. Easily one of my favorite burrito spots in San Francisco.

El Farlito does have other locations in San Francisco and around the Bay Area in case you cannot make it to this location.
author: Paul V.

description:
Our safe go-to for a good Mexican meal!

THE WAIT: There was a line to the door, as always, on a Monday night at 8:30pm. It took maybe 15-20 minutes to order and get our food.

* Chorizo taco - 3 stars
Too soggy, I wished for more crisp on the meat!

* Lengua taco - 4 stars
Pretty good! Soft tender meat for lengua.

* Shrimp and al pastor super burrito - 4 stars
Surprisingly good! Shrimp wasn't the most fresh but added an interesting crunch.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Alright so I drank the SF kool aid and let me tell u it looks a lot like drunken mistakes and el Farolito. It's actually super good (drunk me and sober me agrees). Now, you may be thinking, isn't that judge mental about being drunk? Well I can only speak to my experience and yes, I was inebriated. 

Ok onto the food. I loved the quesadilla. Loved. It. It is HUGE. Just in general, the portions at el farolito are absolutely massive. You will not be disappointed with alllll that cheesy rice carne asada goodness. We also ordered the burrito and it wasn't nearly as good. some of the steak tasted a bit too chewy, meaning that the meat is over cooked. 

This is a SF must. You will be super impressed by the quesadilla !! 

What to try: carne asada dilla

Water review: 8/10
author: Amanda P.

description:
I was born and raised in San Francisco and other than a few years where I've been away for school, I have lived here all my life. So apparently I'm a pretty bad San Franciscan because I have never tried El Farolito. It took a visit from my German host sisters this week to get me to finally venture out to the Mission and get my first ever El Farolito burrito.

It was delicious. I actually don't typically order burritos (I'm more of a quesadilla and taco girl), but even though I don't have many burritos to compare it to, this super burrito with carne asada was bomb. I was also very hungry, and I was also very happy seeing my host sisters, so all this could have contributed to the experience. But it doesn't matter, because in that moment, I thoroughly enjoyed drenching my burrito in salsa and devouring it. 

Minus one star though for the horchata, which was way too sweet and unnatural-tasting.

Guy at the counter was nice. 

I'll be back!
author: Nicole M.

description: One of the best things I've ever eaten. Simple, cheap, melty and beautiful. The only downside is that i wish I ordered another. The line is usually long, but it's worth every minute. Oh, it's huge too. I rarely give the 5*, and this is the perfect example of a great meal in America!
author: Shawn A.

description:
How can I properly give credit to this gem of a restaurant? I dream of the burritos here and hope to someday be close enough so that I can order one every single day. 

I ordered the supreme chorizo burrito and it made all of my dreams come true. The 5 others I was with ordered different things and all were super happy. 

Come here for kick ass food. If any of my friends told me they didn't like this place, I would need to re-evaluate who I'm spending my time with.
author: Maia H.

description:
I came here with my local friend who said that El Farolito has the best burritos ever. She had hyped up the restaurant so much that I was afraid that I would be disappointed. After all, it's just a burrito, right? 

First off, the staff is so nice! The man taking my order seemed to genuinely care about me, and had such great manners. Second, the burritos are AMAZING!!!! My friend was so right, and even with the overhype, I was beyond satisfied. I got the marinated pork (al pastor) super burrito and some chips, which came out to be less than $10! Needless to say, that burrito can easily last two meals. 

This was one of the BEST burritos that I have ever had, and I would definitely come back before I leave SF. I highly recommend it for both its quality and quantity!
author: Will W.

description: A San fransisco staple, a must visit Mexican restaurant if in the city, the  line wasn't too bad on a Friday night, I waited about 10 minutes for my food , nothing out of the norm.
author: Isaac N.

description: As always, DELICIOUS!!! And not crazy overpriced (like everything in SF) either! This time we got the super suiza (think: loaded steak quesadilla) and the grilled chicken super burrito. There's usually a line, but the wait isn't crazy cause the cooks are pounding out the orders. The burritos are HUGE in size (I make 2 meals out of it), and all the food I've had from here is nothing short of amazing. A San Francisco staple for sure!!
author: Katarina L.

description:
I had the chance to try El Farolito after several friends recommended it to me as a MUST while visiting the Mission District in SF. The neighborhood and subsequently the city is known for it's rich history of Mexican cuisine dating back all the way to the Mexican-American war. This specific area of SF is known for the different restaurants that serve up the classics (i.e. burritos, quesadillas, etc.). However, El Farolito is apparently is THE PLACE for amazing Mexican cuisine in the Bay Area so I know I had to try it.

We walked in around 5:30 on a Thursday evening. The second we walked in their was already a line the length of the ordering station to the front door (about 6 people). My friend stayed in line while I scoped out a table where we'd be able to sit.

The restaurant itself isn't decorated in any special way. Kind of a hole in the wall spot that has a ton of people working within an open kitchen, others taking and yelling out order numbers, and customers coming and going  to either dine in or to take out. When it came time to choose I went with the Super Burrito with chicken ($8.25). Stuffed with rice, beans, salsa, avocado, and a host of other ingredients this burrito really packed  a punch. It's definitely recommended if you're really hungry and looking for something that won't only leave you satisfied, but may actually have you needing to take a nap after finishing.

Because of the high volume of people going in and out at any given time I completely understand the rush they have with their service. Not saying it was bad in any sense, but when you order is called they literally fast-walk it to your table, placed it down, and then go back to deliver the next order in the queue. I actually like this though because it means that they're efficient. They don't waste time bringing you your delicious meal.

Just so you know this location is a cash only spot. They're also open super late from what I've heard so if you're visiting the Mission District it seems like a good option after a long night out.

Visit if you get the chance and I can guarantee that you won't be disappointed.
author: Nicholas C.

description:
Feels like you flew down south to Mexico for this foolproof quesadilla!

Starting from the crispy tortilla wrapped around the monstrous handful of stringy mozzarella cheese and carne asda. Carne asada hits the sweet spot (juicy, moist, and tender). Just enough oil to get you through the night. Drench the chili pepper salsa all over and you are in business for a treat. 

Conveniently located in the mission near all the bars and opens real late. We drink just so we can go to El Farolito afterwards. 

Myth: quesadilla suiza will get you through your drunchies and even hangovers
author: Ronald M.

description:
Ohhh myyyyy goshhhh!! El Farolito rocked my world.... and rocked it again and again. Burritos and quesadillas will never be the same. I honestly never knew that a steak and shrimp burrito could be that tender and taste so flavourful! Their shrimps are so plump and meaty, they're definitely not the dinky fishy frozen shrimps you get from the grocery store. They know what they are doing, no questions asked. 

If you live in the bay and never had El Farolito, have you really lived?
author: Diana M.

description: Service is fast, don't worry about the long line out the door. We came around 8/9pm. Workers work hard here! ESP the guy who calls out all the order numbers. Food was hot and yummy. The venue is a bit small, and given its popularity (understandably so), it can get pretty crowded so muster up yourself to prepare for bumping into people while waiting for tables and/or trying to get out of there. Of course I'd come back. I hope this place never shuts down because of gentrification . LOL
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Cash Only
Line moves quickly so read the menu as you wait so you know what to order when it is your turn
Open til 2:30am daily, 3:30am on weekends
Hold onto your ticket number and listen for your number; they bring the food to you
Chips (65 cents) with a serve yourself sauce bar
Say "Super" before each taco order and they'll top your taco off with avocado, and sauce aka the works.
Tacos are $2.95 each, if you "Super" it it'll come out to $4ish
In the photo below, for three of us, we got 9 tacos + 2 beers + a basket of chips for approx. $40, and left incredibly satisfied.
There is beer available for purchase
Complimentary water available as well
Hole in the wall, no frills dining spot
Limited seating inside, but high turnover rate as people are just trying to eat and go
If you're a germophobe, you probably wouldn't like this place
author: Victoria X.

description:
Food: 5/5        price: 5/5          Service: 4/5        Ambience: 2.5/5

What a hidden gem! With more than 4000 reviews and high ratings, El Farolito did not disappoint. A local restaurant located in Mission District, they serve up one of the best mexican food I've had in the area. The menu ranges from burrito, taco, quesadilla, and specialty plates. Wait in line (that's often out the door) until you reach the counter, order, get a number, and a person will take your orders to you. The line is 20 minutes long, another 15m for food - but so worth it! Very reasonable price considering it's SF, and the portions are decent too. Warning: CASH ONLY!

Carne Asada super burrito - with rice, beans, salsa, sour cream, cheese, avocado, and steak. Their signature, and so good! The super burrito is decently sized (big but manageable) with great portion of steak, sour cream, avocado, and not overloaded with only rice and beans. The burrito was served warm, delicious, and hearty. Rice had a nice flavor, and steak was seasoned and charred nicely.

Carnitas super burrito - with rice, beans, salsa, sour cream, cheese, avocado, and fried pork. Super burrito is just awesome in general...carnitas wasn't overly fried and tasted delicious. 

Super Suiza quesadilla - flour tortilla, cheese, steak, sour cream, avocado. THE BEST!!! This is by far the best quesadilla I've had, and my family agrees. The tortilla is hot pressed nicely with a crunch, and the filling is delicious - lots of steak, and a nice blend of cheese, sour cream, and avocado. Loved it!!

I'll be back - worth the line and every penny.

Favorites:
* Carne Asada super burrito ($8.25)
* Carnitas super burrito ($8.25)
* Super Suiza quesadilla ($7.95)
author: Victoria L.

description:
Delicious, authentic, best and biggest burrito I've ever had in my life. 

Long line, but goes by fast. Get plenty of green sauce and chips.
author: Connie Y.

description:
This place is an SF classic! I highly recommend and tell everyone visiting SF that El Farolito should be on your "must-eat" list. 

There is always a line. The line goes by pretty quickly so hang tight! There is not enough seating for everyone so you usually need to hover and/or take your treasures to go (plus the area has a very grimy feel). Also this joint is cash only! 

Carne Asada is THE BOMB! I love the salsa bar and as a fan of green salsa usually take 5-6 small containers of the stuff just for myself :)

We are frequently asked whether we prefer El Farolito or La Taqueria. This is definitely a personal preference and depends how you feel about rice (El Farolito) versus no rice (La Taqueria) in your burrito. My husband feels strongly that a good burrito must have rice, and I can go either way.  I do prefer El Farolito's salsa so for that I give it my vote!!!
author: Michele L.

description:
4.5 stars for a delicious quesadilla.
CASH ONLY!

I didn't have faith in El Farolito after my first visit where I had a burrito.

NOW, I crave the super quesadilla which is almost like a burrito but way better for whatever reason.

There will always be a line, but it's worth it.
I don't think i'll return to getting their burritos, but their quesadillas have me coming back for sure.
My favorite is the green salsa and my partner's favorite is the red.

The seating isn't usually a problem, most people seem to leave, so if you're set on dining in, you'll be able to get a table if you're patient for a few minutes.

The parking here isn't great, but after 6 PM is much easier.
You may have to park up to 3 blocks away, but you'll be able to find something.

Some places are worth a second chance, and I'm SO GLAD my bf made me try this place again.

TOP TIP: You can order food at the El Farolito bar next door and get it to go. It may be faster if the line is passed the door of the bar.
author: Connie T.

description:
The best super burrito I ever had. I come from LA and I have consumed so many burritos they all start to taste alike. But not this spot, I think its the extra ingredients they put in their burrito. 
Came early in the morning right when they first opened, they were still cutting up there carne asada meats, you know that's fresh!
I think the melting cheese, sour cream & avocado in the burrito made the burrito stand out on its own. Add some red salsa at each bite, yum!!!
Real Authentic Mexican Burrito.
Don't let the appearance of the place fool you...yes they may need a lil upgrade, but as long as the tables are clean and the food is good, its ok.... plus their bathroom was actually clean.
author: Maricel J.

description:
Was walking around Mission District, looking for a place to eat and found this place. I really wanted to try this other location, but my friend insisted on eating a burrito. 

The place overall is pretty small, with space barely for both people to get in and out, so it can get pretty tight. It looks more like a single line. 

Ended up getting the super burrito with chorizo as my choice of meat. Boy was that big. I didn't expect it to be of that size. It looked like the size of my chipotle burritos when I stuff them. The ingredients were so simple. but it tasted so good. I almost ranked this over chipotle, but it still remains king in my heart.

Didn't realize how popular this establishment was until we left and saw that the line extended all the way out the door and down the sidewalk a bit. Would definitely come back to try other things, but as for now and from what I've seen, it seems that their super burrito is their best deal.

Important to note: They take cash only
author: Timothy D.

description:
Can't believe I've never reviewed this place. My go-to is super quesadilla and my choice of meat varies. Love how they make it. That grease! Yummm! I can never finish the whole thing. 
Husband's go to is super burrito, no beans usually with carne asada or carnitas. 
This place has always been popular even wayyyyy before hipsters discovered them. Now I want some quesadilla.
author: Claire J.

description: This place is my favorite burrito spot in the mission. I get the same thing wherever I go, for continuity- carnitas super burrito no rice. This is the best one, I have tried a lot. People always tell me this place is overrated but I have yet to find better! Go check them out, and they don't accept cards so don't forget cash!
author: Abby R.

description:
Just good food.  Super authentic, amazing burritos that they make right in front of you.  We tried the carne asada super burrito and it was great!  It had a kick to it, but was really, really good. 

The environment was a lot of fun, too!  Straightforward, fun, and real.  Someone stood up in the middle of the restaurant and started playing cantina music on a guitar and singing.  Awesome experience!
author: Kathryn M.

description:
Absolutely go to this legendary place! It's crowded and cramped but these features just add to its charm. I had a vegetarian burrito, and in all it's glory it was one of the best I've ever eaten. Nicely pressed tortilla, delicious mixture of beans and Mexican rice, avocado, the best balance of cheese. And don't forget to load up on ALL the salsas at the salsa area. My personal favorite is the verde sauce but they are all really delicious. 

Prices are totally worth it, given the amount of food you get. I saved half my burrito for later and it was still just as scrumptious. I highly recommend that you visit here, even just to see it.
author: Caroline D.

description: My friend hyped up this place so much, saying this has the best quesadillas and burritos I would ever taste. It lived up to the hype. There was a line out the door, but it moved pretty fast. We waited about 15-20 minutes to order and for the food to come out. The quesadilla was huge! Such chessy goodness. I also really enjoyed the burrito. The meat was really tender and it was so filling. I only ate half and was already full from that. Such big portions for the price you're getting. There's also to go containers for the sauces at the end of the counter. Highly recommend for anybody visiting SF who wants authentic Mexican food. Make sure to bring cash!!
author: Alina H.

description:
Now that the old Cancun has shut down, El Farolito has become my #2 favorite burrito spot in the mission (after La Taqueria). Except, La Taqueria closes early while El Farolito is more respectful of the 1am cravings I have. It takes about 5-10 minutes to stand in line to order your burrito, and another 10 or so minutes for it to be ready. This place is cash-only, but there are a few ATMs nearby (not inside Farolito though).

I always order either the super burrito, or the super steak quesadilla. The portions are massive, and the quality is also 10/10. This is a great place to eat even if you did not spend the night drinking. I came here with my sister and brother-in-law, who live in London and wanted to try good SF burritos and they were not disappointed either.
author: Karanveer M.

description:
I first heard about this place because it showed up on some list of best burritos in the Bay. After that I mentally had it bookmarked  and thought I should check this place out one day! Years passed and never went until I realized it's actually quite close to a club that I frequent. Once this connection was made my mind was blown and I immediately went to go check this place out after a night of dancing.

We got there around 2am and there was a line. Some in the line were drunk (expected, given the time) and some were arguing with each other (I guess, also expected given the time) but I think deep down we were all excited to get our eats on!

This place definitely lives up to its hype. Everything we had was delicious! (And I've been back several times since, and everything I order is still always delicious). The burrito is good, nice chunky meat, good ratio of sauce, and it has a nice kick to it. But my favorite thing here are the nachos or their flautas because I LOVE flautas to begin with and the nachos are more fun to eat with a group. So, really, just go and order whatever you're in the mood for at the time because the quality of ingredients they use is the same regardless of what you order and they know how to give their food flavor!

Aaannddd I have made myself hungry just thinking and writing about the food here...strongly recommend checking this place out, if you haven't already!
author: Taline M.

description: I was a little thrown off when my order came to $25 for some tacos and a burrito. However, I was accepting of the order because I special orders my tacos to be "super" style even though it wasn't on the menu. When the price came to $25 I asked if that was right and he said yes, because my tacos are "super" that is why there is an extra up-charge. When I came home  I realized that the tacos are have actually been prepared as regular style and not super as I requested. I been trying to contact them all night and they won't answer their phone. I'm really frustrated because I paid for the speciality tacos and he assured me that they would be super. The crunchy tacos are hard and dry and the meat lacks lots of flavor. I am disappointed in this establishment being that this is suppose to be he best and most authentic Mexican spot in San Francisco. The staff was rude and the food is not good at all. They need to pay attention to the customer and the customers specific order instead of rushing people out of the line. I will not be going back.
author: Nick Y.

description:
In spite of long lines, the staff seemed really efficient at what they do and got everyone through pretty quickly. The food was served piping hot and was full of flavor, and the prices were reasonable for the area.

I had the lengua and carnitas tacos, and my husband had chorizo and carnitas tacos, as well as a super burrito. I liked the slightly spicy kick to the salsa, and the lengua seemed to be of good quality. The burrito was definitely the standout of the meal, though. Proportions of the ingredients were great, making every bite a delicious one.
author: Dianna W.

description:
Cheap & delicious Quesadillas conveniently located near 24th st bart!

- Came here first-time at 11 pm on a weekend. Long line, and the place is packed! Waited for about 20 minutes to order.

- Ordered the regular Quesadilla Suiza: steak, cheese, and 2 tortillas, for only $5 ish. Taste was bomb!!! Will def come back for another Super Quesadilla (with avocado). 

- Ambiance is very cheery. However it's way too crowded for the small place it has. The aisle is very narrow that people kept bumping into one another. 

- Staff is very efficient. Good customer service. 

- Perfect place for a late night grab-n-go. It opens til 3 am! 

-Cash only.
author: Jess W.

description: Love this joint so much I even put it into my children's book "Isaac Goes to San Francisco"
author: Michael C.

description:
We came back (not drunk) for more food!
I had a Regular Taco with Carne Asada ($2.95) and shared a Suiza (Carne Asada Quesadilla) for $4.75.

The taco was delicious! I loved the flavorful chopped meat. It came with 2 flour tortillas, but I think I probably only needed one. I feel like I can easily eat 5 of these. 

So we totally thought the size of a Suiza was the same with a Super Suiza, but without Sour Cream and Avocado. Wrong! It was not only smaller in size, but the carne asada was not chopped; literally a piece of steak meat in between two tortillas. I did not enjoy this at all. The meat was tough and when I bit into it, the entire piece of meat just pulled out...

Also I don't want to sound mean, but the singer in the restaurant was making eating at the restaurant awkward. He came over to our table and pushed his money bag in front of us and wouldn't leave until money was given....ughs

Anyway still like this place and will be back for more!
author: Alice L.

description: This place is my go-to burrito place. Don't let looks deceive you; from the outside it may look like just any other place, but trust me, the food here is one of the best in SF. The meat is so juicy and there's so many different salsas for you to choose from. The portions are great and it's cheap!
author: Connor W.

description:
Oh man, so good! Rolled up to El Farolito at 10 pm on a Saturday night. They are open late which is a big plus.

There was a long line of folks. I ordered the carne asada plate which is around $10 and delicious! Lots of meat, avocado, beans, rice and tortillas. More than enough food and hit the spot after a night of drinks. Look forward to returning.
author: Jasmine B.

description: Great local authentic spot for awesome Mexican food. Burritos (get the super burrito instead of the regular since super comes with avocado, sour cream and cheese), quesadillas, sandwiches, tacos,tostadas, complete meals-they have it all. Their chili relleno is sooo good. Everything is sooo good. Fresh burritos made on the spot with tons of scooped avocados. Depending on how hungry your you are, 1 burrito can be enough to share since each one weighs about the size of 1 small infant. Quick service. Small joint. You know it is good since there is always a line!  Remember CASH only!
author: Vivian T.

description:
As some people read this review, they may wonder how a guy in Birmingham, Alabama could possibly know good Mexican food. But alas, we not only have some of the best taco places I have eaten in my fair city, but I have tried my fair share of Mexican eateries all throughout Texas. I have even dabbled in a few places randomly found on Yelp in the bay area. Granted the local (Alabama) burrito scene is not quite like I have had in SF. But I do know a good burrito. Unfortunately, poor decision making led me to not even select a burrito. A mistake I will remedy in the future. This trip however was late night and led by a culinary encyclopedia of a co-worker.

We arrived with a line out the door as to be expected. But the line moved pretty fast. I fully expected to get a burrito and a beer. But apparently the beer is not an option at this hour. It threw me into a tailspin. Then I saw a quesadilla come out that was the size of Rhode Island, my co-worker also ordered one, and I could feel the eyes behind me. In a haste, I ordered the quesadilla with my co-worker having the foresight of a need for burrito in the future. Again with unfortunate circumstance, there is no way to eat one of these desert sized tortilla deliciousness and even half a burrito... at least at 2 AM. The quesadilla itself was fantastic. Had I known it had sour cream, I probably would have held off. But overall it was extremely tasty. As we were finishing up, we were asked to leave by some form of officer because of closing time. Not sure if it was a real cop (it was 2:30 AM after all - my senses weren't the keenest) but they were a little pushy. Which I do understand with a 2:30 AM closing times. I'm sure the story these walls could tell. I look forward to going back and eating the burrito in my next visit. For now, the whole experience is four stars.
author: Will B.

description:
Burritos, tacos, dillas... Whatever you like they absolutely nail it. 

After a long night of drinking we had to go grab a burrito. I got the super carne asada burrito ( only could eat half because it was 2 in the morning). It came out hot and steamy and looking like heaven. Now.. I've had their food many times, and it's always amazing. In my opinion it may be the best taqueria in the Bay.. definitely top 3.. 

When I took that first bite, I went from drunk and tired to their being a fiesta in my mouth... I could hear a mariachi band playing in the background as I kept eating.. and before you know I start salsa dancing out of nowhere! Damn it was a good burrito. 

But really El Farolito is great, everybody knows it's great and it will continue being great.
author: Michael R.

description:
Thanks, El Farolito, for ruining my homecoming meal. Just flew in from New Orleans and was seriously looking forward to a classic fat Mission burrito. By some bizarre turn of events, my regular place, Guadalajara, was closed but El Farolito is also open late. Too bad I didn't just wait. 
One of the saddest burritos I've had. I got the supreme veggie, and it was about half the size of the meat burritos. And the fillings...  I think they did the opposite of everything I wanted. 
There was avocado in it when I'd asked for none. There was no sour cream, no salsa... only rice and beans and a few measly shreds of lettuce. Seriously? To add insult to injury, I found a sizable chunk of chicken half way through.  
And they charged me $13 for this and a side of guac. Definitely wasn't worth the cost, or the long rowdy line I had to stand in. Super disappointed.
author: Ellery D.

description:
I can see why this might be a popular place to check out when drunk, but other than that, it didn't really strike a chord for me. I've definitely had better Mexican food before - especially in LA. 

The carne asada burrito was a bit too tasteless in my opinion. It was massive (which is nice because you get more bang for your buck); however, I couldn't even finish half and ended up eating my friend's quesadillas instead. 

The quesadillas were huge and decent tasting, but I think I would've preferred them thinner and crunchier.
author: Angelina H.

description:
These are hands down the best burritos in San Francisco. You will have to wait in line when you go because it is that popular. There is minimal seating inside but you can obviously take it to go, which I recommend. They have a pretty standard menu of burritos, tacos, sides, quesadillas, etc. I always get the super veggie burrito and am never disappointed. The flavors are amazing and the burrito is just so good. It's impossible to eat it all but you end up doing just that because it is so freaking good. 

Remember, this place is cash only!!
author: Joanna V.

description:
When you get here, you'll most likely see a line forming from outside to inside. Usually I go to Taqueria Cancún, but when I got there this past Saturday they were closed for construction! So, 4 more blocks down I looked at El Farolito as they were bookmarked as another spot to go to.  Let's just say, your seating here is limited, however people are in and out of this place. 

We had a group of 5 when we came here and even though it was a long walk from where we came from, everyone was satisfied in the end after tasting the delicious burritos. I ordered the chorizo and carnitas tacos, along with a super Al Pastor burrito. Let's just say I was too confident in hungry I was. I didn't finish the burrito, but got it to go. However, the tacos were absolutely delicious. 

All the reviews that you have read about this place, it's true. It's great. It's super convenient too as it's right next to a bart station. If you want a great mission burrito, check this place out.
author: Bruce K.

description:
My friend was visiting SF from NY and was craving Mexican so I picked the most popular one- El Farolito.

This place legit looks like a hole in the wall. It has the smallest entrance ever, I was thinking like giant windows and double doors but it was the opposite of that. It's pretty small inside too and can get cramped when the lines build up but if you go to the back, there are booths to sit in.

I ordered 2 tacos, one lengua and I swear I said al pastor but I got a carne asada taco instead. The carne asada one was alright but the lengua one was so good omg. I haven't had a solid lengua taco in a long time.

My friend ordered quesadilla for dos and the guy taking our order was like "thats for 2 people are you sure?" and he said yeah but when the order came out, he realized it was a huge mistake because their quesadillas are HUGE and now there were TWO giant quesadillas on our table. He ended up only finishing one and it was pretty entertaining watching him try to finish just one quesadilla. That thing is massive.

Overall this place is pretty good. I've definitely had better Mexican food before when I lived in SoCal but this place is probably comes the closest to legit SoCal Mexican food. It's a bit of a drive for me since I don't live anywhere near SF but if i'm ever back in the area, I will definitely be back here!
author: Shannon C.

description:
One of my favorite places in the Mission to head to after a night out! It's open late, and relatively quick though there often is a line out the door. NOTE: CASH ONLY.

If you're looking to get tacos, burritos, and nachos after a night out, this place is awesome and popular by uber or if you are within short walking distance. I ubered here and endured the line out the door for 15-20 minutes (it was pretty damn cold) to get solid and delicious Carnitas Quesadillas! This place has a lot of old-fashioned yellow booths that are neither aesthetic nor comfortable, but you don't really care when you are cold, still slightly drunk, and starving. Definitely worth for the satisfaction of good carne asada, carnitas, and al pastor!
author: Clarissa C.

description:
Cheap, authentic, huge portion. 
I came in around 12:00PM on a Sunday, the place smells like carne asada. By 1:00PM, this place was packed with people. I ordered the super burrito with the famous carne asada and I was not disappointed. The meat was so flavorful, crispy and sharp. Combined with all the other typical ingredient in a burrito, it really does live up to the name super burrito. Probably one of the best burrito I have had in a while. I would come back again!
author: Kaylee P.

description: One of the best burritos I've ever eaten. The place doesn't look much, but you get best that first impression, try the super burrito. I also had Carne Asada and it is a good meal. Mind that is a cash only place.
author: Ursula P.

description: Quality mission style burrito. Stopped in on a Saturday night and the line quickly grew out of the door. Had the carne asada burrito. YUM! Paired with the spicy green salsa this hit the spot. Crowded restaurant, hard to find a table and worth it
author: Christen D.

description:
Best burrito in the US! Who would have thought that title would belong to a hole in the wall San Francisco restaurant?! 

It lives up to its title. I was highly impressed.

I've been there twice and both times there was a wait but the line moved quickly. CASH ONLY!

So back to the burrito...
Oh. My. God. Each bite was the perfect bite. 

This is what my boyfriend had to say about it..
"One bite into this burrito made me realize I knew nothing about them until this point. The worlds of fresh, tender steak with homemade guacamole, cheese, tomatoes, and sour cream came together in perfect harmony in a warm tortilla as opposed to battling for supremacy in it. Every bite was filled with immense flavor. So much so, that I had to remind myself to breathe in between bites."

So yeah. Get the damn burrito.
author: Erin G.

description:
Great burritos and fast service. 
This is my go-to when this far down in the Mission!
author: Alejandra A.

description:
I ordered the carnitas super burrito! And was great! The mix of beans, cream cheese, avocado, rice and meat was perfect. Juicy, tender and tasty! Although the carnitas meat wasn't the best I had, the combination of the elements was really tasty!

The tacos looked pretty big an amazing too! I definitely have to go back!
author: Celia N.

description:
So, the food here isn't the best Mexican food I've had, and if this was in SoCal I'd probably never come here because it would be too pricy for what I got, but given that it's open late, and that we are in San Francisco, this place is a bargain and a steal!

At about $5-6, I got the steak quesadilla which was excellently made, and tastes great, especially late at night. It's not a fancy or anything, but it really hits the craving, especially after a night out. The salsas are excellently made, and nice and spicy, and my friend got some tacos that looked great as well.

They are cash only I believe, but I guess that's just part of being in the Mission.
author: Tyler T.

description:
If you're out late and feeling hungry, definitely check this place out!  I couldn't believe that there was a line at 2 in the morning.  By the time we left, it was close to 3am and the line was still long!  It wasn't a long wait though.  Probably 10-15 minutes at the most.

They have a good variety of meat to choose from and they give you plenty of it too.  I was surprised on how much meat they gave me for my tacos.  

The salsa was good.  They have some spicy salsa, and it definitely hit the spot.  

Great place to try if you want some yummy authentic Mexican food!
author: Samantha L.

description:
This place saved my life last Monday night, lol. Went here for some late night drunchies and it totally hit the spot. It was a little past midnight and there was a bit of a line, but nothing too major. 

I ordered the quesadilla para dos and split it with a friend. Honestly, this thing is monstrous! You might get away with splitting it with 3 people if you're in the sharing mood, lol. If not, just split it with 1 other person as intended. As far as flavor goes, this has to be one of the best, if not the best quesadillas I've ever had! The carne asada was so flavorful, as was the cheese. The fat chunks of avocado were yum as well. 

The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars (I'd give it 4.5) is because I ordered a carnitas super burrito as well, and it fell a little short of expectations. While it was a good carnitas burrito, Guadalajara down the street's carnitas burrito blows it out the water. But, I hear the carne asada burrito here it to die for, so I'll try it in the future and adjust my rating accordingly, lol.
author: Dennis R.

description: The best burrito in the Mission (and therefore the world). I get the carne asada super burrito and drench it with their avocado salsa. I don't have the language capabilities to describe how great it tastes, so just come here and try it yourself.
author: Daniel N.

description:
Solid, darn near amazing Mexican food. Cash only, constant line out the door as it should be.  Oh how I love driving past the new hipster restaurants and seeing them empty while the mainstays in the Mission are buzzing with life and full. 

I had the carne asada super burrito with no tortilla and my husband had the super chile relleno burrito. Both were amazing! Truly, thru far exceeded our expectations. Then as we were leaving and taking pictures with ominous ATM out front, the security guard comes over and says "Hey are you guys into sports?" We replied "Yeah, we were mad we missed the Celtics game today! No where to watch it!" (Side note: Heck no I'm not paying for cable! We've got that fabulous antenna on 3 smart televisions and Wi-Fi in the house, I'm good!")

So,  Mr. Security Guard pulls us inside the Farollito Bar next door which is equipped with 3 big screens with all the basketball games plaguing! And if you order your food next door they'll bring it to you hot and fresh! We stood back like "Whaaaat?" at this moment feeling extra  VIP.

Oh we'll be back my friend you can count on that. WE WILL BE BACK!
author: Milan F.

description:
We were staying nearby and decided to walk over. There was a line when we got there and it continued nonstop as we ate. But the line goes by fast and you get your food quickly. Everything on the menu sounds delicious and as I saw things coming out, I noticed very large portions. We ordered a burrito and shrimp tostada and it was really good. Probably on the top of my list for Mexican food. Come here if you want the real stuff. The price is also super cheap for such large and delicious portions. Also, the man at the register was super friendly. Wish I had gone back again! 

*this place is cash only. Be prepared.
author: Melissa A.

description:
Ordered a burrito and torta but when I got home I see a burrito and a taco.

This place use to be good but has gone downhill fast.

Buyer beware.
author: vin t.

description: I'm giving 4 starts because I've only been once but my experience was good. I ordered the Stuffed Quesadilla with Steak and it was amazing. It has cheese, sour cream and avocados. It's huge too, I couldn't finish it. I will say that it is CASH ONLY. The closest ATM charged I think $3.95 but I found a cheaper one that only charges $2.50 at the market a couple of stores to the right.
author: Claudine R.

description: Quesadilla para dos with adobada is really good and filling!!! If you eat in the portions are bigger ;)
author: Natalie G.

description:
The queue is super long.  

Chips at 65 cents is a deal.  Help yourself to the tasty salsa.  

Clientele could be a bit rough and particular, as they wouldn't even let me get in between then for a cup of water that I was trying to pour on my own. So i think you better know what you want as you are ordering otherwise it could become a tad testy.  

The burrito is huge, enough to feed two.  I had the Al Pastor burrito which was thoroughly covered in that signature red/orange oil.  Very yummy and satisfying.  Don't expect much for decor, it's not much to look at, it's value and tasty only here.  Not ideal for little kids I'd say...hand washing sinks are located outside of the restrooms which was welcome.
author: Monty W.

description: This place is so great it's amazing. It feels like heaven in my mouth every time I bite into one of their burritos.
author: Marc T.

description:
I can't even start express how amazing the food is. Like you know what you're getting yourself into when you walk into a concrete floored, not too many who lock eyes, and a jukebox on the wall filled with all of the historic tunes that will create the mood and help you enjoy the food even better! This place is the ultimate gem in San Fran! Nothing, I mean nothing compares to this place! I dream about that quesadilla all day and night!!

Talk about best damn quesadilla/burrito I have ever had! I have been to lots I mean way too many taco joints, or establishments that are known for their style of Mexican food or secret sauce recipes. EL FAROLITO TAKES THE CAKE!!! ***Round of applause!!!***

This is a true food haven!!

The Super suiza isn't just a quesadilla it's crossed with a burrito or something like that, just has one fold on the sides and bing, bang, boom!! here you are, this breathtaking beauty beneath your eyes! You won't leave hungry!!! Thin sliced marinated steak grilled to perfection, served on a grilled flour tortilla with all the best fixings you can ask for on this godlike concoction!! 

Luckily my girlfriend and I walked in before the massive wave of hungry people possibly at the same level of excitement as me, cause they looked like locals, and I'm just a hungry tourist so, I felt the vibes mannn. 

It's amazing! truly is! Thanks for keeping it original El Farolito! With green or red sauce it doesn't matter, this shows change doesn't add anything to something that doesn't need to be changed. Too many Mexican restaurants with all these weird sauces and fusions that ruins the essence. Thanks for keeping it REAL everyone!!

And no lie next time I book a flight to SF, this place is the first spot Ima hit up!!!!
author: Daniel Y.

description:
Not going to lie, someone recommended the super al pastor burrito because they said it was the best they ever had. I was skeptical. Very skeptical.

But I am so glad they were right.

The al pastor super burrito is bomb.gov . It is that legit.

Order it! You won't be disappointed. It's a big honkin' burrito but you'll finish it. It's that good.

Only warning I have is the location isn't in the best part of town, but the really good eats rarely are.
author: Vuong P.

description:
Mission style Mexican food in it's purest form. 
The menu has something for everyone, if you take someone here and they don't like the food, then erase them from your life!

The thing I always get is the super quesadilla suiza with half lengua and half pastor it is an unprecedented meatsperience... a meatsterpiece.

Location wise it's nice that its located so close to Bart, but the restaurant is far from an ideal layout, but part of the full mission experience. The place is crowded and typically full of drunk mission people after certain hours (it is open til 3am lol). Seating is always super limited and there is always a line out the door. They do have a bathroom though.

This is hallowed ground.
author: Jacob v.

description: I was very disappointed with the order that I received tonight. I ordered 4 Super Tacos And was charged for $25. I confirmed with the cashier if this was a charge for 4tacos, and he said YES. I also confirmed with him that we wanted Super Tacos, even though it was on the menu. When I opened them up at home, they were just regular tacos with only extra onion, & meat. Where is the rest of them that usually go with Super Tacos?!? I was very frustrated because I was way overcharged for what I got! These tacos also look really dry with no sauce. Definitely will not recommend!
author: Loc L.

description:
Suiza!!!!

I haven't been here in years but this has always been one of my favorite places. 

I came here after a night out to grab a bite and as always the service was fast and the food was great. 

Staff here were also very friendly and kind. 

We were able to order and find seating fast. The place is extremely busy but service is quick. I encourage everyone to give this place a try!!!
author: M AngelosMom H.

description: Great tacos and amazing price!! There's always a wait on weekends even during non-meal hours, but the line moves quickly. Also try the nachos!
author: Amanda F.

description: I have been wanting to come to this place for a long time but is too lazy to commute. After class, I had some time so I decided today is the day. There was already a line at the door so it gave me time to decide on what to order. They have a variety of meat to choose from carnitas to beef tongue. I ordered the steak super burrito with everything. They have a salsa bar so you can choose from whatever you want. I got the green one which was surprisingly spicy for me but tasted delicious with the burrito. There are few seats to choose from and the tacqueria is small. The steak was crunchy and very good compared to other tacquerias but overall I thought this place was ok, nothing amazing. I would come here again to try other items like the super quesodilla.
author: Ivy M.

description:
3.5 stars, rounded up.

Got a suiza, which was similar to a quesadilla.  It had a good portion of meat inside, nicely grilled on the outside so the tortilla wasn't soggy.  Next time I will get it without the sour cream because it was a little overpowering.

We also tried the brain tacos and the intestine tacos.  I never had brain before, it was pretty much as I expected.  Very creamy texture, almost like custard.  Not much flavor, could have used a lot more seasoning.  The intestines I thought were not great.  I've had intestines before, and while not my favorite, I thought these were a little extra funky and chewy.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Dudeee, this place will forever be the best Mexican spot I have ever been to. I recently moved to New York, and you don't know how many times I cried at a Mexican restaurant because it'll just never be the sameeee.....

Nothing, absolutely nothing compares to El Farolito unless it's an actual place in Mexico. My boyfriend and I always get the burrito and super quesadilla. The super quesadilla is cooked to perfection here. The carne asada is nicely marinated, extremely juicy and the ingredients is wonderfully simple. They don't put that extra sh*t like LETTUCE....People who put lettuce in my quesadillas I just send it back. Blasphemy! And the quesadilla is nicely toasted, so every bite you get a nice crunch and the richness of the meat, sour cream, salsa, etc. 

Wonderful spot. And they open late at night. The only thing I suggest to not walk alone late at night to this place. ALSO, cash only.
author: Frances T.

description:
This is probably the best burrito I've ever had in my life. I say that with great precaution, as I am from Texas and I've lived in Los Angeles. Great Mexican food has surrounded me my entire life. I've had burritos all over the place - and I think I've found the perfect one. 

Forget La Taqueria down the street, with their enormously over-rated lines, come to El Farolito and endure whatever line they have.

The guy who usually takes our order is super sweet and always nails it. I love that you can choose wheat and spinach for tortilla - a detail that most authentic taquerias don't provide. I've had three different burritos here, and they got better with each order. The last one I had was the grand daddy of all - and Now I know what to get. 

Visit 1: Super Chicken Burrito on Wheat, no sour cream, black beans, and grilled. Very good burrito! But...something was missing. 
Visit 2: Super Al Pastor Burrito on Wheat, no sour cream, black beans, and grilled. Oh...My...God....this thing was AMAZING! The marinated pork was so juicy and tender.....flavor explosions with every bite!
Visit 2: Super Al Pastor AND SHRIMP Burrito on Wheat, No sour Cream, black beans, and grilled. Wow....just WOW. This thing was incredible. There were about 10 giant, perfectly cooked grilled shrimp IN MY BURRITO! Mixed with the Al Pastor...this thing was a homerun. I wish I had one of these in my hand at all times. 

Look no further - go to El Farolito NOW!.
author: Steve S.

description: Fresh ingredients, and tasted great. Man behind the counter was very helpful with my orders.
author: Winglo A.

description:
Woah, woah, woah!!!! Hold up! Wait a minute! Let me put some salsa in it!!!! 

THIS PLACE IS BOMB!!!!!!!! We stumble upon this spot from the good reviews on yelp and since our usual spot was out of a certain dish we like (boujee I know) but anyway, what an amazing decision!!

I just consumed a shredded chicken super burrito, super beautiful. My friends enjoyed the Quesadilla Super Suiza, Super Buritto Carne Asada, and Carne Asada Torta. There compliments consisted of 

"this food is beautiful" 
"I'm stuffed but I'll order another one right now"
"the salsa, something about the salsa is doing it for me"
"this is fire"

If those comments don't make you walk over to El Farolito right now, I'm not sure you can be trusted. MUST TRY!!!!! Coming back soon!!
author: Leslie H.

description:
You know that place that is overhyped, has a bazillion reviews and everyone claims it's the best hole in the wall Mexican taqueria north of the San  Mateo border, yes that. 

El Farolito confuses me. It's cash only, dinghy, smells of pee near the entrance, with dirty tables that make you want to take a bath.

The food looks delicious, inviting and worthy of the long lines you battle, in this cash only joint.

The guacamole was ok, salsa was interesting - they have a free salsa corner for customer. 

You order your tacos, quesadilla or whatever you fancy with the sides and protein that you crave, and  you get called when it is ready in about 5-10 minutes.

Trying to find a table is harder than it looks, however you can get lucky if you throw your jacket while waiting in line - slightly douchy but this food requires you sit down. 

Overall the food was decent, not the best by any measure, but a taste of the vibrant, chaotic, mesmerizing Mission.
author: Sam K.

description:
The most mundane burrito you can have, but the value is good.

$9 dollars will give you a burrito that is filling, but don't expect anything else. It's essentially a flavorless, soggy burrito that is 75% filling, 25% meat. I even asked for my carnitas to be extra crispy twice, but that request was ignored. However, they did get my request to have no sour cream.

Don't waste your time here. It's even mediocre while drunk.
author: Alfonzo J.

description: Bomb quesadilla with steak! Very tasty. All flavor very good and tasty we don't have anything taste as good as this in LA got the burrito it was not as good I would give it a 3 star the quesadilla with steak was amazing! And so big good for 2 or 3
author: Johnny A.

description:
Some of the best Mexican food I've had in San Fransisco. The space is extremely no-frills and actually quite dingy. It makes you wonder if it's safe to eat here. But the line out the door during lunch made it seem like we had to give it a try. I got the veggie super burrito, which had sour cream. He tortilla was wonderfully warm, and he rice and beans were delicious. I love that thy use fresh avocado. The burrito was also HUGE! I would definitely share it if you're not a big eater. 

Cash only.
author: Chai S.

description:
This is an updated rating for another item I ordered.

The previous 1 start rating was for the horrible vegetarian burrito, which I still stand by.

I decided to give this place another shot, so I ordered the super veggie taco with refried beans. It was a well done taco. The cheese was good, avocado was good, pico was good and they put a nice amount of sour cream on there, just the way I like it.

The salsas are flavorful and spicy, so I put a good amount on the taco.

I'd probably eat it again if I was there. Not the most amazing taco ever, but pretty solid.
author: Shruti D.

description:
They serve the biggest burrito I've ever eaten. It's good, but you need to be prepared. My formidable appetite was just enough to finish it without feeling like I wanted to throw up from all the food. Lol.

Seriously though, it's just authentic Mexican food served quite simply and in enormous portions. The guys who work there speak both Spanish and English (for the most part) and they're friendly. The line goes pretty quickly for a place that's always packed. Kind of like a Trader Joe's line for the cash register. Speaking of cash, it is cash only.

I had a nice meal there with 2 other friends. Tables seat 4 max and it might be challenging to find seating. Take out is advised, or small groups. Enjoy!
author: Audrey L.

description:
best burrito in san francisco!!! i recommend ordering to go and bringing your food to Dolores Park, located just a few blocks away, for a view of the city and great people watching. 
I like to order their veggie burrito with the spinach tortilla. And the chips are AMAZING. make sure to grab extra salsa :-)
author: Mady M.

description:
If you're looking for a quick line, amazing quality, and room to sit, I recommend going to Farolito's Oakland location.

I live near this location, and each time I visit I end up in a long line and waiting for a table to open up. The food is good, but not always consistent, especially when they are really busy.

That being said- I always get the same thing, regardless of location: the super suiza with steak. The flavor is incredible, and you get a killer bang for your buck. Sometimes I can't even finish the whole quesadilla, which means a lot considering I'm a big fella. 

The verdict? If you are visiting from out of town and want to get the Farolito experience, this spot is fine. As for me, I'll be making my way to Oakland for the added perks.
author: Nicholas G.

description: 8 years after first stepping into El Farolito and I'm still here! Burritos and quesadillas are the best and I recommend ordering two, one to eat there and one to-go! It's not the fanciest place, but it's worth far more than you pay.
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description:
Burritos are amazing here as well as their tacos. 
Their lines can get pretty long but worth the wait. 
It's one of the better burritos I have ever tried in the bay area. Totally recommend it. 

I ordered the super suiza quesadilla as well as the carne asada burrito. The burrito is super juicy and tender. The portions are huge as well. 

The workers here are very professional and super fast. Can't wait to try the rest of their menu.
author: Chul L.

description:
Yassssssssss, what else needs to be said

If your hungry, this is the answer
If you're drunk, this is the answer
If you're feeling fat, this is the answer
If you're crazing Mexican food, this is the answer
If you want to see an eclectic group of people, this is the answer
author: Jacob C.

description:
This is a very authentic Mexican place. I would recommend the al pastor (marinated pork) burrito. The burritos are big too and very filling. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is the place is small, cash only, and the service isn't that quick. 
The hot sauce is amazing too!
author: Makaela M.

description: They make a breakfast burrito that will blow you away.  If you can deal with longer lines and a dirtier establishment you will be rewarded.
author: Brandon H.

description:
Night 1 in San Fran was done. Kinda upset everything closes around 2! So at the end of the night we needed some late night grub. Checked yelp and this spot got over 4k reviews, and was open! Once we got there the line was literally down the street. Prb as long as the club we went to earlier. Not gonna lie this did raise my expectations alot. 
 The food was not that memorable, now I must admit I was pretty drunk at the time. But even my sober friends did not like it. He said his burrito was dry, and our nachos were blah. This spot reminds me of Taco Burrito King in Chicago. Another late night taco spot open real late, thats mostly eaten by drunk customers. Maybe I was being spoiled by all the other spots here if SF, but even drunk this place did not do it for me.
author: AJ M.

description: Every time I bring up the fact that there is no good Mexican food in San Francisco somebody brings up El Farolito. I went into this little hole in the wall with high hopes. I really shouldn't trust SF natives to know what good Mexican is.... It was edible. I can't even say it was good. Basic bland food. At least it wasn't bad right? I would've given it three stars but their toilet was overflowing and it was pretty gross to look at.
author: Kimberly A.

description: Gave El Farolito another try and the carne asada was fantastic.
author: Ricky R.

description:
I live only 3 blocks from here and it takes every shred of self-control within my body (as well as my frequent lack of cash on hand) to not get Farolito every time I go to the BART station, which is at least twice a day. 

I always get the same thing - the super quesadilla with carne asade for $8. The super alone is almost enough for 2 people. If I come with a friend I'll get it for two, because that's $12 for two GIANT quesadillas. My boyfriend will always get the super carne asada burrito, which is also around $8-9. As former residents of Southern California, this is as close as it's gonna get here in the Bay. It's definitely as good as it gets.
author: Jenny D.

description:
I have only heard about the Mission street burritos. It was totally worth the hype. These are the best burritos I ever had. Quick, friendly, but limited seating space. 

Cash only!
author: Vanessa N.

description:
El Farolito

STOP IT!!! SUE ME BECAUSE AFTER MY 21 YEARS OF LIVING (as an SF native), THIS WAS MY FIRST BURRITO EVER!!! I only ever had tacos and skipped burritos, my friend told me to just try the burrito and if I didn't like it she'd save it for her lunch tomorrow. I grew up a picky eater so I have a very set expectation for things. I've had every component of what's in a burrito separately but never together... and the verdict for my first burrito ever is that I'm in LOVE! I ordered a carne asada super burrito that was epically massive. For the price of $7.75, it's definitely so much more worth it than any other authentic food I can think of. A side of chips was $0.65. The ratio of rice, to meat, was enough with hints of salsa (spicy but not too spicy),  avocado, and sour cream. I skipped out on the beans to save myself later.. 

The service is really nice too. My only wish is for people to clean up after themselves because the workers here work hard trying to balance out feeding the frenzy and making sure everyone is satisfied.
author: Liza H.

description:
Super quesadilla is bomb here. Huge portions packed with loads of flavor. Line can get long late at night but moves fairly fast. 

Also, it's cash only.
author: Jackie S.

description:
(Cash is king here)

Big line always, but definitely worth the wait to get decent Mexican in San Francisco. The quesadillas are so savory and have a bit of crunch, while the burritos are filled to the brim with the most flavorful meat and classic ingredients. Farolito is the only place I've had midnight cravings for when I think about each bite.
author: David Y.

description: I've loved and hated this spot over the years, but I decided to give it another try, earlier in the day, when beer, et al. hasn't affected my palette. There always seems to be a line, and it moves slower than beloved Taqueria down the street. The tacos are decent; I tried the pollo (chicken) and veggie. All in all, this is an average place, despite all the hype. There really is nothing phenomenal going here other than hype. They do have a good guacamole, cucumber salsa, and fresh chips. I'd say attention to detail lacks here, the avocado on my taco was well past ripe-- you know how they begin to get a bit funky. If you stick to the basics here, you'll be fine. Otherwise, there are better spots around.
author: Brian J.

description:
The food was amazing! It felt authentic. If you have a chance to eat here, do it! It will definitely be worth the trip. 
*only cash accepted!
author: Lina L.

description:
Just your basic Mexican joint, the tacos are large portions but the burritos lacked meat.

I got the regular cabeza burrito with extra guac and I was definitely filled up but it wasn't the most amazing burrito ever. Not even better than average. Nor was it bad. Just meh.
author: Lilian K.

description:
Really good burritos at a fair price. I was barely able to finish it but didn't want to stop! The line out the door let us know this is a popular place but the line moves pretty quickly. 
The wife and I got carne asada burritos. The meat was perfect. Not dry at all but also not so greasy that the last quarter of the burrito is soaked with grease like other places I've been to. Definitely a must if in San Francisco!
author: Patrick M.

description:
The Mission has so many places to get a burrito that would take awhile to explore them all. El Farolito is located a short walk from the 24th St BART for those rocking the car-free or car-light lifestyle.

The best option for vegans here is the Regular Veggie Burrito. It is $6.75 & comes w/ lettuce, rice, beans, avocado, & salsa. Make sure to request it w/o cheese to have it vegan as it comes by default w/ cheese even though it isn't listed on the menu as that.

Chips are an extra 65 cents. While other taquerias in the Mission offer complimentary chips the fee is minimal, plus avocado is giving free on the burrito w/o additional charge.

There is a three item salsa bar including 2 red salsa, 1 green salsa, & pickled veggies. The salsa is on the spicy side. The roasted chili pepper on the salsa bar packs some heat.

It was a very filling burrito & although I finished it, I almost didn't. This is probably the most filling veggie burrito in the Mission. It is a bit heavy on rice & feel that El Farolito is doing the opposite of La Taqueria's famous no rice burrito. La Taqueria is nearby & famously does no rice to pack more meat into their burritos which does nothing for this vegan so perhaps La Taqueria is giving El Farolito all their rice as El Farolito's burrito is a bit heavy on the rice which I don't necessarily mind. 

This place gets quite packed yet was here for an early dinner just after 5pm so wasn't any problem to find a seat yet be prepared to share a table & lines can get long.
author: Shane S.

description:
Our flight to San Francisco came in late and we got off the plane hungry and craving some late night snack. A quick Yelp search and we found El Farolito with 4000+ reviews and decided to check it out! We parked on the street and saw the line out of the door at El Farolito, even at 1am! The line went by relatively quickly, as the staff were swift and diligent. Tables and seats are limited, so there is a chance that you might have to take orders to-go.

For our late-night grub, we ordered a Carne Asada and Carnitas Taco, a Regular Burrito and Grilled Onions. The Carnitas Taco was my favorite, the deep fried pork was crispy, hot and fresh, laying on a bed of fresh onions and cilantro. El Farolito is very generous with the portions, not holding back on packing the taco and burrito with ingredients. The Regular Burrito includes rice, beans, salsa, onions, cilantro and meat, but I would say 90% of the burrito was rice and beans, makes for one heck of a meal....or pillow. We chose a table right next to the salsa bar, making it easy access to the delicious salsa verde. 

We enjoyed our late-night experience at El Farolito, a melting pot of diversity and unique patrons that make San Fran so amazingly interesting and vibrant. The jukebox inside also adds a muy caliente atmosphere late into the evening. Certainly a place to visit when we are craving Mexican food and away from San Diego.
author: Angela Y.

description:
I absolutely love coming here, I've been coming here for the last couple of years every since my friend introduced it to me. They have great quality meats and everything taste fresh. 

I always get the super carne asada burrito with extra whip cream. It's pretty good honestly but I feel like some days taste better than others, maybe the cooks I don't know but that's alright it's still pretty good! I just wished it was more consistent:

During peak times the wait just to order could take 10minutes and the order sometimes takes up to 15 minutes, the most I've ever waited was 30 minutes for a burrito. 

Overall I love this place but i wished the burritos were more consistent with flavor.
author: Alberto S.

description:
I've heard many good things about this place, so when I got a chance to stop by, I was super excited!! 

I've eaten my fair share of tacos in my lifetime, and I've never seen such LARGE tacos! I thought I could eat 3 tacos but I was so wrong. Was quite full after just 2! 

I ordered the Al Pastor and Pollo Asado, and my friends ordered a mix of many other tacos. We also got chips for the table and they have a couple of salads to choose from as well. Be warned: all are pretty spicy! I can handle my spice but their pico de gallo was much spicier than any other version I've had. Al Pastor Taco was also quite spicy too, but all were so tasty! Definitely hits the spot and honestly makes for great drunk food! Haha. 

Definitely will come back to try other stuff on their menu!
author: Tina T.

description:
Decent prices for quick, authentic Mexican! My super burrito (meat, cheese, beans, salsa, sour cream, avocado) and chips were under $10.

The carne asada had great flavor and the whole burrito had a little kick from the salsa. I would have liked more avocado but that's personal preference.

I wish they served margaritas (they only have beer for alcoholic drinks) but aside from that, I'm a fan!
author: Julie S.

description: Line was long as expected but we got through pretty quickly. Only cash is accepted so be sure to bring some. Place is very affordable but store is not the cleanest looking restaurant. I ordered a carne asada super burrito. It was good. Fiancée ordered the super veggie burrito and she liked it. Burritos are huge! They sell alcohol, Mexican drinks (agua frescas) and soda.
author: Juan M.

description:
I think El Farolito may have fallen victim to its own success. The food quality varies wildly here: sometimes the meat is very dry and my burrito is unflavorful, other times it's acceptable (but never *good*). I don't ever want to wait in a long line to play Russian roulette for a 50-50 mediocre/bad burrito. 

NOTE FOR STICKLERS OF CLEANLINESS: As someone who really doesn't care about the occasional sticky tabletop or dirty menu, eating in this restaurant felt like eating on the worst trains that BART has to offer - that's how dirty it was!! Trash left on the counter, food dropped on tables (and not wiped down), dusty and stained floors, random graffiti everywhere, grimy seats, rowdy late-night drunk crowd.....I just wanted to scarf down my food as fast as I could and get out asap. *shudders*
author: Anna C.

description: For the price that you're paying you get more than enough food to satisfy you! The super veggie burrito was delicious and had a great combination of rice, beans avocado, sour cream and more! The alambres was a huge plate piled high with steak, bacon, sautéed onions and peppers, as well as rice and beans. This is a great place to eat and the surrounding area is a nice walk!
author: Smrithi M.

description:
Came here based off the fantastic reviews. I would say this place is solid for SF. 

For all the people who say, "Best burrito ever!".. sorry to burst your bubble but it's definitely not. If you been to any decent Mexican joint in SD you'd understand what I'm talking about.

This place does get busy during the weekends so be aware! The workers are fast and professional in what they do. I'd recommend sharing a burrito with someone as they are pretty big. The carne asada is tender and very flavorful! I think I'd just get a meat burrito with just guacamole next time. As the rice and beans are too much of fillers in my opinion. 

The area seems a bit shady but not to fret, just eat your food, clean up after yourself, and keep cool. You'll be good! 

If you're from SD just enjoy the food and relax. I know it's not like home, but it'll suffice in the Bay!
author: Jim G.

description: For a classic taco place in the Mission, you would think this food would be just what the doctor ordered when we wandered around looking for a substitute for La Taqueria (which is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays). We stopped here after seeing the crazy long line because lines = good to a peckish brain. It was a little pricey and cash only but I'd pay anything for a good taco or burrito. My husband got a carne asada burrito and I got two carnitas tacos. I'm a girl of habits. To quote the two star rating tagline: "Meh. I've experienced better." There was nothing BAD, just nothing good. I hate beans and there were loose beans in my tacos rip. I bet this place is great for a drunk late night snack with the pals but not for me at 8pm on a Monday before heading to Urban Putt
author: Daisy K.

description:
Bangin' burritos. You've gotta come here. 

I had been coming to San Francisco really often and was mad nobody told me about this earlier.
author: Tom N.

description:
Food - 5 stars hands down - The best sauces/salsas. Flavorful and high quality. 

And then... it all goes downhill... pretty fast. 

Cash only. 
Hygiene - Could be improved. The interiors are not just old, they're dirty. The outdoors could use a high pressure water wash. 
Cigarette smoke being blown around, mosquito menace outside the place, noisy and full of pollution.
