Parking - based on your luck

Wait: if the line is to the door, expect to wait 35 minutes from when you join the line, for your food. 

Personally, I won't be going back here again despite the 5 star food because the overall experience was pretty bad. I even got bit by something on my eyelid and it has swollen up.
author: Raj R.

description:
Summary (TLDR): Huge. Heavenly. Delectable. Rich.

I got the super burrito...
Tortilla: Perfect thickness, tasty
Fillings: Rich, well balanced, good texture.
Salsa: Amazing, rich

I couldn't ask for anything more. Will be back here any time I'm in SF.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Parking is a bit tough since it is in the Mission district. Cash only. 

I'm giving this place a five star for San Francisco Mexican food. Still getting used to ride and beans in my burrito since I'm from Southern California. Two super burritos and two agua frescas for under $22 though?!? Talk about a steal. Lengua super burrito was good as well as the super breakfast burrito. Definitely coming back.
author: Richard L.

description:
El Farolito is by far, my favorite place to grab a burrito in the bay area. 

Service here is awesome. The cashier is very friendly and always smiling. The line usually goes out the door but it usually moves fast. The food came out fairly quick as well. This location isn't in a great part of San Fran. There's a lot of homeless people wandering the streets. Be sure to hide any valuables and lock your car! Street parking can be a challenge. 

Carne asada super burrito: 5/5 Filled with rice, beans, cheese, avocado, sour cream, & meat of choice, this burrito is HUGE. All for less than $8. The rice itself is very tasty. The meat was cooked perfectly and very tender.
Horchata: 3/5 Bland after taste. I would pass on this next time. 
Chips: 3.5/5 Not sure why our bag of chips were so stale and greasy. The brown bag was drenched in oil at the bottom- big turn off! 

On the downside, seating is very limited and the tables are dirty. There is a guitar player that will play some music and go around each table ASKING for tips and won't leave until you give him something, even if you've only just arrived there.

All in all, portion sizes are great. I've never been able to finish an entire super burrito. Great prices and fantastic food! Definitely check this place out if you're ever in the city.
author: Sandra N.

description:
This place is famous for burritos? My burrito consisted mainly of rice (see picture). I couldn't even finish it because there was just too much beans and rice. And the little meat that it did have (carne asasa) was pretty tough and flavorless. If this is one of the highest rated Mexican places in Ncal, I will probably stick to Mexican food in Socal. 

Taco was fairly decent.
author: Angelo B.

description: So DIRTY & GROSS!! I felt like I was dining in a third world country -- and I don't mean just inside the restaurant, as the surrounding neighborhood and streets were also filthy. I'm shocked that so many people continue to go here despite these conditions. I might understand if the food was mind-blowing, but it's not! La Taqueria has a MUCH better burrito and the environment doesn't make you want to grab soap and hand sanitizer.
author: Kat V.

description: Apparently this is a must eat chain when in the area for mexican food. We had never heard of this place until our recent trip last week. We didn't go to the one in the mission district which has the most reviews and photos per yelp. We caught this one on the way back to our hotel in burlingame. The portions are huge for a low price! And they definitely did not skimp on proteins for our super nachos and super suiza quesadilla. Flavor on everything was good, asada was better than carnitas. For a quick fix in the future we'll definitely keep this in mind!
author: Irene N.

description:
Hands down best burritos in the city. If you're coming on a Fri,Sat or Sun be prepared to wait for 20-30mins before you can place your order (worth the wait). Super Burrito is bomb. Their serving size is such a good deal for the price. 

Viva El Farlotio
author: Vinith J.

description:
This place is pretty good!

There was about a 15 minute wait to order food since the line goes past the door. I came on a Saturday afternoon (~12 pm) and ordered the Super Vegetarian Burrito ($7.50). My friend got the Super Nachos ($7.50) but asked for extra avocado ($2). 

The employees were really busy. When I first got my burrito, I noticed that there was no lettuce. In addition, there were not too many avocado pieces. I asked the employee if I can get some lettuce and they ended up replacing my whole burrito even though I took a few bites out of it. 

The replaced vegetarian burrito was really good. There were a lot more avocados and lettuce in it although most of the burrito consisted of rice and beans. I think the lettuce that was used was romaine and it was super crunchy. I liked how avocados were used instead of guacamole. The cheese was melted along the edges of the wrap and had a better quality than the cheaper shredded cheese that you may find in a burrito at Taco Bell. The wrap was very warm. I was glad that the employees did not squish the beans. I feel like this would make the burrito more soupy. The whole burrito was not very saucy. I could actually taste each individual ingredient. I could not finish the whole burrito. 

My friend really enjoyed his nachos. He says that he gets it every time he comes here.

I will say that there is a lot of cross contamination. For example, the same cooking utensils were used to handle the different types of meat. I saw the liquid from the beans spill over onto the rice as the employees scooped up the beans.
author: Kristina M.

description:
This place is an institution. 

Here's why it gets five stars from me:

1. They clean this place every day. I walk by it in the morning, and they are always washing the floor. Would that every taqueria in the Mission do this. 

2. Their chile relleno burrito is out of this world. I went there recently for it expecting an adequate, and filling burrito. Thus, I was floored by the first bite - the perfect amount of flavor and moisture. Even though I was helplessly full, I persevered through the whole burrito. Just delicious.
author: Marcel M.

description: We are from NY and were in search of real Mexican food. We saw a few places in this area and one night decided to come over here. We took the train from Union Sq. It was easy to get here. The place was not too far from the station. The food was delicious.
author: Kattherine S.

description:
I had to give it one less star bc of the stench of urine in the doorway  I had to deal with while I waited in line to order.  Seriously, they need to hose down the area so people don't lose their appetite.  The other thing I find really unsanitary is the lack of gloves while assembling the burritos. And lastly, the floor. The floor is disgusting. The rug covering the wet floor. Ugh. The food must be good for so many people to endure this.

Eh, just had my carne asada burrito and coming from chitown, I've had better. Really don't understand it. Even the rice is tastier at chipotle. Sorry.
author: mei s.

description: My favorite burrito spot in the city! You can expect a long line and authentic Mexican food. I came around 12am and line was out the door. Fast service though!!!!
author: Jay D H.

description: I've been here multiple times for burritos, tacos and more but the best items here are the quesadillas -- specifically the suiza or the super. They're HUGE and could probably feed two people. My favorite meat choices here are the carnitas and carne asada (great on any menu item)
author: Hana S.

description:
This place is the bomb especially when you are drunk and hungry. It's one of those Mexican joints that open till 2am in the Mission district. I got the regular burrito ( really should have gotten the super burrito like the other yelpers suggested), and a couple of tacos to try. The marinated pork, beef head, beef tongue and steak were all delicious. You won't go wrong with any of the meat choices.They are definitely not cheap, charging almost $3 a taco. I came twice on the same week, once at night and once in the morning. I first came around 12am and thought the place was a bit dirty, but when I came again the second time during the day, they cleaned up the floors and it was much better. For some reason, I feel like Mexican food just taste better at night, perhaps we all need some grease late in the evening. 

Make sure to watch the parking signs as I got my car towed away so it's one damn expensive taco I had.
author: Cindy H.

description:
How did this drop to 4 stars? What's wrong with you San Francisco? 

While my favorite burritos in SF are those served at La Espiga de Oro, El Farolito is a very close second and really it's the ultimate of ultimate comfort foods in the city. THIS is what a Carne Asada burrito is supposed to taste like, how it should be prepared, and what it should cost. And, it's literally right next to the BART station for Rapid Burrito Acquisition.

If you want to mix things up a little bit, try the enchiliadas as they too are phenomenal. They come complete with tons of ancho chili sauce and cheese so be prepared to be in digestion mode for about five days.

I know El Taqueria's neon lights are attractive but that place is grossly inferior to here and don't let any transplant into the city convince you otherwise.
author: Matt M.

description: What else can I add that everyone else has written. I like it and most peeps seem to chose this spot for late nite chow. If you ask, they'll say El Farolito! It's always the standard supa carne asada burrito with a large Horchata. It's also entertaining to watch the different characters in line. Gotta love the Mission!
author: Moneey P.

description: This is exactly what I wanted: A delicious and satisfying Mexican lunch served by guys who probably learned how to cook from their mothers. The place is loud and scrappy, and probably hasn't changed much since gentrification set in here in SF. I will be back
author: Glenn S.

description:
This place is dirty and busy but has some good food. It's especially well located in the mission next to 24th St, which is why there's always a line towards the end of the night.

I think the super quesadilla is my favourite here, but the burritos are also good. They have cabeza which is often surprisingly missing from some less authentic places. The chips and salsa options are solid.

Overall it's a solid choice, especially when you don't want to go searching across the mission for a late-night burrito.
author: Joe B.

description:
Good: 
- Big portions
- Fast
- Carne asada
- Hella beans
- Fulfilled my desire to eat a mission burrito... but then I realized most burritos I eat are mission style anyways so...

Bad: 
- Bland chicken
- Hair in burrito :'(
- Small amount of avocado

Tips:
- ~$9 for super burrito
- Cash only
- Find street parking nearby (can be difficult but just keep circling)
- Check out Mission Dolores park nearby
author: Joann L.

description: Went cuz of the hype, but was really disappointed. Firstly, the place is really messy and I didn't even feel like eating there, but unfortunately nothing else was open that late. The food wasn't that good as well, definitely had way better Mexican food.
author: Abhichandra R.

description:
If I am willing to go out of my way to come here 3 times in a week..there must be something special at El Farolito. 

For the longest time I had it ingrained that La Taqueria was the best burrito/taco place in SF and to some extent, I still believe this (at least for tacos), but EL FAROLITO. MY GOSH. Your quesadillas have satisfied my cravings every single time! 

I can't finish a burrito myself, so I tend to stray away from them and I'm not a beans person - so the quesadilla suiza (steak, mozz) with avocado is my go to here. Every size quesadilla is amazing though and the quesadilla para dos (steak, avocado, sour cream, mozz) can actually be para tres and you'll still be extremely full. I've literally never seen a larger quesadilla in my life (two ginormous plates) and it's currently going for like $13, I can't believe it That could legit feed a family and is a great choice, post drinking shenanerdoodles and all! Tacos are flavorful and I'm currently on a quest to find the best lengua tacos. I would say the meat on the tacos are hefty and delicious (but be warned, the sauce they put on the lengua is just a bit spicy so if you're not into that, maybe you can ask for sauce on the side or not at all, or suck it up because the meat is so yummy!).  

This place is CASH ONLY so make sure you bring money or have venmo to pay your drunk friends back! I love that it's open late, one of the perks that make it a great go to late night and possibility what gives El Farolito an edge over La Taqueria. There is usually a line and wait time varies but the line moves fast and its completely worth it! 

~happychowing!
author: Deanna S.

description: Oh fuck me up, this is some good burrito! This is what I expected when they told me SF had some bomb ass burritos. It flavours are insane and portions are HUGE! I got the chorizo egg scramble breakfast burrito and I ascended to heaven.
author: Marco T.

description:
Pros: 
-popular Mexican joint in the mission district of SF. 
-food is decent and somewhat still affordable compared to the city.

Cons: 
-This place is located in a very dirty area. With that said, homeless people will most likely bother you while you are in line outside.
-Cash only.....
-Parking is tricky, but if you literally go a few blocks away from mission, you can find parking.

Honestly, I have no idea why this place is so highly rated. I got a carne asada super burrito and it wasn't the best thing I ever had. They didn't even mix the ingredients so half my bites were just sour cream and beans...

Probably never coming back to this specific location. It's dirty, crowded and gross.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
sooooooo goood!!! i actually haven't had a mission st burrito in a while and i forgot how good they were. i even remember not being that impressed the last time i had one, but for some reason, this past trip was amazing. 

i got a carne asada super burrito. it was so filling (and i'm a pretty big dude) and the flavor was excellent. my favorite part of mission st burritos, especially here is the tortilla. they're toasted just so perfectly. and i love their salsas. i don't think i would get anything else here but the burritos. 

i actually came here because la taqueria is closed on mondays and tuesdays, but i was totally fine with that. a friend of mine was visiting from chicago so i took him here to check out our famous mission st burritos and he absolutely loved it. 

it's cash only, use the bathroom before you come or wait till later, lines can be long during peak hours, mexican coke to wash it down. you're welcome.
author: Enoch C.

description:
Came here hangry after a nauseating commute on an empty stomach from Berkeley. I wolfed down the quesadilla suiza, which was so delicious, greasy, cheesy, and filling. I highly recommend this quesadilla (thanks for the rec, Stephanie Y. ! ) as it doesn't have any of the rice or beans (my friends split a giant burrito but didn't like it much since the rice was mushy and the burrito filling itself was pretty dry) and just enough flour wrap that doesn't get in the way of the suiza or cheese. I regret looking at just how much grease there was on the bottom of my basket -- but hey, that's just a measure of how much I *didn't* ingest, right? 

The word about El Farolito has definitely spread; I saw people from all ages, friend groups, etc.come here to grab a bite. The wait wasn't terrible -- the downsides are that 1) it's cash only 2) there really isn't much room to do anything except sit and eat. Expect a tight squeeze when walking toward the back of this restaurant. 

I'm gonna recommend this place for its low cost, authenticity, proximity to Bart! I'll be coming back here for sure.
author: Julia Y.

description: Very good food , quick and convenient..  order at the counter , then they will bring it to your table .  Super Suszia Quesadillas are the way to go!b. Heaven in your mouth !!!  Another perk is that they serve beer
author: Jacob H.

description: Amazing burritos here.  Visited from the East coast, and was pointed along to this establishment, and I was definitely impressed.  Every part of the burrito to be delicious and the sauces on the side were also extremely tasty.  Next time I'm in the area, I will definitely be stopping by!
author: Andy L.

description:
I don't know why it took me so long to write this review. This is an SF drunk night food spot in the Mission, and a must-stop if you are a tourist and want to live like the locals. This is a proper burrito joint - no nonsense, no frills, cut to the point fast, reasonably priced Mexican food. They also have beer if you want to treat yo'self to a proper food and beverage pairing.

Everyone raves about their burritos, but I recently I tried their quesadilla and I have been thinking about it ever since (completely sober during the weekday daytime). Last time I went with a group of 4, we ordered a burrito and a quesadilla (regular sized) and we were stuffed at the end of the meal. All for around $20. You can't beat that in a city where it's hard to get cheap and good eats in bustling parts of SF. Also, also, don't forget about the sauce section, lots of yummy salsas (ranging in spiciness) and pickled veggies (my fave). The selection there is UNLIMITED, I repeat, UNLIMITED.

Be prepared to wait in a line, but if you are in a group, I recommend having one guy order and the rest of the party wait at a table for that poor friend to deliver it all to you. Heads up, don't get too drunk and leave any valuables there. I did that my first time here and never saw my wallet again =(
author: Frances P.

description: Not for the vegetarian/vegan crowd ! I got the veggie burrito and it was just ice burg lettuce, sour cream, and rice !! GROSS !! The wait was ridiculous  for a whole lot of NOTHING !!
author: Quanae B.

description: I dont know why this place is so huped but it totallt sucks. I ordered the super burrito and there was literally 4 small pieces of meat. Trust me, this place is not worth the hype.
author: Manjil S.

description:
CASH ONLY
Long line but it goes real quick and the people working there make it fun. The restaurant is a lot deeper inside so there will be seats (eventually). My husband wanted a night snack and it seems that's what others were there for. He ordered a couple of tacos and I got some chips and salsa. He downed the tacos so fast and I loved the roasty flavor of the chips (not your typical tostitos). Pretty authentic as it can get and the portions are huge. Also, kind of in a ghetto ish area.
author: Jackie R.

description:
*CASH ONLY*
And make sure to bring a fat wad of cash, because whoooops, you want a superburrito. Aaaand you want tacos! Different types of meat, too. Also, don't forget the quesadillas! 

Granted, I've only come here afterhours (i.e. past midnight) but that's only because the Mission is out of the way during the weekdays that it only is fair to come with friends after a fun night on the weekends, right? :-) 
Everything I have had here is BOMB. I may or may not be salivating as I write this, but I am thinking about the superburrito with shrimp and carne asada - How you can taste the charcoal-grilled shrimp, the juicy and tender steak (NO DRY MEAT ALLOWED), the just-right greasy beans, smothered with guacamole, and wrapped in a warmly grilled tortilla blanket. Every bite is magical. 

+LENGUE TACOS. Aka beef tongue. Soooo freaking juicy and tender. If you have not had lengue, THIS is your place. It will set your benchmark high, but who wants crappy lengue? It's like having your first uni experience with one that is bad quality. 

Be prepared for a line. But it goes fast. Helps that it's open kitchen so you can see them working hard for your delectable meal. WORTH.
author: Vickie Z.

description:
I've only been to SF twice before moving here not too long ago, and have already eaten at this place thrice than the number of times I've visited the city.

Phenomenal quesadillas -- just the right amount of char, without the tortilla drying out and getting hard, and melted symphony of cheese, sour cream, avocado, rice, and beans on the inside -- in enormous portions.

I'd recommend splitting, but you'll probably want your own anyway.
author: Mel L.

description:
Some dank authentic Mexican food that is both for casual eats and the late night munchies. Huge portion sizes at affordable prices. Great burritos and shrimp quesadillas!! The carne asada and al pastor are both well-seasoned and you cannot go wrong with either. The line can get long at times but trust it is worth. Service is also very prompt. 

Be sure to bring cash (they do not take credit card) and for parking, try looking in the side streets.
author: Kevin T.

description:
There are better tacos for less in New York City; a sacrilegious statement, but true nonetheless.

Was ushered to El Farolito at midnight by my sister as an introduction to the quintessential San Francisco taco joint.  After hiding all of the valuables in the car, made our way into the rather shabby-appearing taco joint to order a series of tacos - lengua, al pastor, carnitas, steak - and a basket of chips.

Tacos were exploding full - almost too big to lift to the face without thinning it out a bit with a fork.  Unfortunately, the tacos lacked a distinguishing flavor, particularly the al pastor, which would ordinarily offer the chance for improvement and improvisation.  Ultimately, the carnitas might have been the best.

Not sure what the hype is all about.  Probably requires alcohol.
author: Steve L.

description: Sadly, my super carne asada burrito did not live up to the hype.  While, the burrito is pretty big, I felt like they gave me a bean burrito instead.  There was barely any meat to be found.  Every bite was just another mouthful of beans.  I have definitely had way better burritos.  I also didn't like that all 3 salsas were pretty mild.  I wish they had a spicy salsa option.
author: Jenn W.

description:
4200 reviews - el farolito is clearly the king of San Francisco Mexican food. But, if it's the only Mexican place you mention when I ask you, my respect for your knowledge of San Francisco immediately drops. Why? Even tourists have heard of el farolito. You're clearly not making the best of the best city! There's several better taquerias just in walking distance.  

But let's cover what's good:
-Prices
-Open late
-Next to a BART station (convenient)

The bad:
-Only cash (sure, this is common in taquerias, but plenty also take cards)
-Crowds on weekends

And the neutral things:
-Food is tasty but not exemplary
-Salsas
-Atmosphere is grungy heading toward yucky but it's a taqueria so step off

I mean the reality is this is a good restaurant, there's just dozens of good Mexican restaurants in the mission. Truthfully I'd rate them slightly below average. I'm going to disagree with my good friend Ben here, though - I really appreciate that they have actually-spicy salsa!

Getting my chorizo + al pastor super nachos (including guac and sour cream) can happen until the wee hours, for a couple bucks less than many places. I mean heck this place is cheaper than chipotle (and way better). Can't complain about any of that! El Farolito has its moments - it's just never what I'm really hoping for.
author: Chris S.

description:
You come for the burritos, not the decor. You come back for more burritos.

We were happy to find giant quantities for a super reasonable price. One burrito satisfied me for 2 meals, and despite my thin appearance, I can put quite a bit away. I ordered the regular chicken burrito, my husband the steak super burrito; both were delicious. Chips come on the side and they had a great flavor. The salsa bar has 3 different salsa, try them all, but I favored the pico.  

Remember- Cash only and limited seating! Even though it was busy, the line moves quickly.

This is a must if you're looking for authentic food for un pocco de dinero.
author: Katy E.

description:
This was probably the only bad place I tried during my trip up to SF and all I can take away from it is that people in SF do not know good Mexican food. As crowded as this place was, you would expect something amazing.

The burritos and quesadillas that we got were just a mess. No, they didn't explode from their tortillas, but the ingredients just didn't taste as good together as they could have. Any taco truck in LA would give you a better burrito with half the heartburn and grease. Not saying that heartburn and grease are not something to look forward to with Mexican food in general, but the taste has to bring you over to the pro side of the pros and cons of a late night burrito.

The place is a mess and with the quantity of money the place is making, they should be able to afford at least one part time cleaner. Just wipe off the tables once every 30 minutes. A homeless man could probably get a good meal by just eating the leftovers people left on those tables.
author: Andrew V.

description:
I LOVE El Farolito! Given the line is always out the freakin' door, but for good reason! There is a huge selection of items on the menu and so many different combinations to choose from. The employees there are extremely nice and they work pretty fast! 

I always get myself either tacos or nachos and they seriously pack so much meat onto your plate! Be prepared to leave with huge food coma!

Best part about El Farlito is that they are open til 2:30am! Oh yeah! Midnight cravings fulfilled! :)
author: Meliza M.

description:
Tell me how this is still the most lit location of the El Farolito chain?! I've been coming here for years, but have only now reviewed this place??? Blasphemy. 

Straight up, as good as it gets. It's fast, it's delicious, it's cheap, what more can you ask for? I get the carne asada super burrito with black beans, just my preference, but it's so good!!!! And the salsa, can i just say MA DAMNNNN. The green salsa and the red salsa are sooo good. The pico, I can do without. But all for a little under $10. And the burritos are huge, can definitely turn it into 2 meals. Their super quesadilla is also dank, would recommend if you feeling a lil cheesy. The al pastor is pretty damn good too, so if you prefer pork over beef, go that route! Honestly, whatever you get, you can't really go wrong!

If you haven't tried this burrito yet, do ya self a favor, call ya self an uber, and get ya self an El Farolito burrito.
author: Eva C.

description: This place has food that rocks.... the store is crowded, so be patient. I found the food to be fresh and full of flavor. The price is not bad, but bring cash only.  Also parking is a bitch. I had to park two blocks away. It was a nice walk, so it was not too bad
author: Paul G.

description:
Yummy burritos! They are huge though so maybe get one to split with a friend if you don't eat too much! I love that this place was very authentic and well priced. I got the super burrito and I highly recommend.

Don't forget to bring cash because this is CASH ONLY!
author: Daniel C.

description:
Burritos are usually the first thing I get when trying a new taqueria. I was recommended to this place with the claim that they had the best burritos so I ordered my go to: an al pastor super burrito. Hands down one of the best burritos I've had!

Meat: Al pastor was well marinated and tender. Some places don't seem to get this choice of protein right, but El Farolito does.

Rice: Cooked just right and has nice flavor. This ingredient can make or break a burrito for me.

Tortilla: El Farolito can wrap a burrito pretty well. One of my pet peeves in a burrito is a chunk of wrap in every bite. I can understand the ends being folded but I'm not too forgiving in the middle. I also prefer the tortilla to be soft and thin so it doesn't over power the other flavors. This burrito was great!

Ratios: They make well balanced burritos. Every bite was bursting with flavor.

They did not disappoint! Only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the salsa. I appreciate when a taqueria can showcase a special sauce but this place was pretty standard. Aside from that, I highly recommend this place!
author: Jeremy L.

description:
Came here with some friends after drinking on a Tuesday night (Club goin up!) 

It was about 11pm and the line was out the door but only had to wait about 10 minutes so it was fairly quick. 

Tacos we got:
Carne Asada - the OG go-to. Always a solid choice. 

Al pastor - definitely bigger chunks of meat. Yum!

Carnitas - this is my favorite and I personally think it's the most tasty. 

One of the top taco places in the mission! I only like la taqueria better since they grill their burritos, but overall a solid spot to go to if you need some post party grub!
author: Brianne I.

description: Favorite. Restaurant.In. San.Francisco. I have dreams about this place. YUM.
author: Emily M.

description:
Great cheap Mexican fare in the Mission. A very Mission-y late night experience. I just got one chorizo taco to satisfy my craving. It came out to $3.20 post-tax or whatever which is fine. The chorizo was delicious and oily. I wish they added more grilled onions or had a slice of lime or whatever. 
Overall, would come again for late night drunk food or a cheap bite. 
This place is CASH ONLY.
author: Amy X.

description: The best Mexican in the Mission. Carne Asada is all day! Cash only. Big burritos, come hungry.
author: Sam A.

description: Favorite burrito place in SF! After tax and all it's still under $9! It's the size of my forearm and definitely more than enough for a meal. And for me personally, it's like two meals.
author: Jenna V.

description:
Eating a burrito in the Mission District is a must when visiting San Francisco. The burritos at El Farolito are extremely delicious. The proportions of meat, cheese, sour cream, guacamole, rice, and beans are spread evenly throughout so the burrito is the same from start to finish. The restaurant atmosphere is nothing fancy. I would eat at El Farolito again. The food is great, and well made for the price you pay, but isn't going to change your life; so don't get your expectations up too high. 
Remember to bring cold hard cash as this place is cash only!
author: Trevor J.

description:
Oh yes, so so good. This is a classic hole-in-the-wall SF Mexican spot that's pretty Mexican-authentic (but who am I to say?) 

I'm in love with their spicy burritos and the option to get shrimp.

It's a crowded, busy environment that gets crazy on weekend nights. But you'll be served in good time and it will be worth the craziness! They know how to handle business pretty well. 

The burritos are some of the most scrumptious things you'll put in your mouth all year.

Tip: Bring cash because I think they are cash only!
author: Bridgett W.

description:
This place rocks.  Places like this make life better.  Just good food.  Not fancy at all.  Folks from all walks of life in one place, eating food and getting along.  Places like this make America great.  

This is one of the best taquerias in SF.  One of the Crown Jewels.  Go here.
author: Michael S.

description:
Came here after climbing around 11pm, and there was still a long line outside the door.
Cash only!! 

They have a pretty large menu, and i wasnt sure what to order but i ended up getting the shrimp since it seems popular. I got the super shrimp burrito,  this burrito is definitely super size. It was the size of my forearm and i could barely eat a 1/3 of it. 

It had huge shrimp inside, not the tiny ones but more tiger sized. It was packed full of rice, beans, cheese, and all other deliciousness. The chips here are super crunchy and fresh, the salsa bar is also great because it has a nice variety of salsas to go with your food. 

Must go in the mission for affordable large portions!
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Came here around 10:30 on Monday night. Place was packed! 
Food is great!! Prices are great (burrito was $8ish and loaded quesadilla was around $7.50)! Decor and ambiance is a little dingy, but it's easily overlooked with the great food! 
It's a spot that's open late so a great little taqueria to stumble into after a night at the bars. 

I have come here numerous times and have never been disappointed. 
Fun item they have that we always get are the grilled onions! Not many places have these and you have to get a batch when you're here!

If you're in the mission looking for a non-fancy Mexican place, look no further! This spot is excellent!
author: Milena R.

description:
My Favorite here is their nachos! Love the chips they use and all that comes with gotta get the carne asada super and have it with their green hot sauce.

My second favorite is the Boss's burrito truly a work of art.
author: Michael W.

description:
My all time favorite burrito!! Called me biased but the Mission District in San Francisco has the best burritos in the world! (Sorry SoCal). 

I love that they grill the outside of the burrito. For me, that's the kicker that pushes it above some of the other options in the area. 

You got to go classic carne asada super burrito. Ugh I'm getting seriously hungry just writing this. 

Cash only!
author: Sam A.

description:
I absolutely love love LOVEEE this place! This is hands down, my all time favorite Mexican mom and pop store! This is like ultimate love put into your food. The neighborhood it's located is kinda sketchy, but what place isn't? Especially for the best Mexican food I've ever had in Norcal. 

Get the Suiza, it's the best ever. It's like a really huge quesadilla with generous portions! You get to choose what meat and it comes with so much bold flavors!

Even, if you can't finish it, (it's enough for 2-3 people), it tastes great after heating it up too!
author: Vivian V.

description:
Spicy and I love it.. I recommend super quesadilla.
I love mission area and I do recommend three or four restaurants in this area..but this one on top of my list for Mexican food
author: Kevin K.

description: Omg. Excellent in all ways. I'll be honest, the day before I had got Mexican food in the Mission and I left that restaurant feeling pretty disappointed and was craving more. My friend insisted we give El Farolito a try. I had a pretty good feeling it was going to be good given that there was a line out the door and it wasn't even lunch hour! I ordered the supreme burrito with carne asada for meat. The supreme burrito comes with sour cream and guac and costs a few bucks more than the regular burrito, but I highly recommend it because it's really what holds your burrito together. And it's also delicious. I liked that there was a generous portion of meat and not overwhelmingly rice and beans. The burrito itself is huge and you could definitely save half of it for later (or eat the whole thing like I did...) Their salsa bar is also excellent and has a couple different mild/medium/hot spicy choices. Looking forward to coming here again!
author: Michael Z.

description:
Authentic cheap and huge burritos (with an A health rating despite appearances)! 

My friend brought me here because the burritos here are well-known. There was a line out the door but it moved quickly. The restaurant is very tightly packed so finding a place to sit is difficult especially when coming in a group. Luckily we were able to grab a table in the back but I recommend taking the food to go to eat more comfortably. In addition, the restaurant at first seemed to have a questionable level of cleanliness but they have a posted A grade from the city to refute concerns. 

Carnitas burrito- Fantastic! The burritos are huge! The Mexican rice was excellent and there is a good portion of meat. The foil is wrapped very tightly around the burrito which actually made it hard to eat but nevertheless the quality was superior and the price was reasonable.
author: Jessica W.

description: Super burrito!! Quesedilla para dos with guac and sour cream inside! Amazing...
author: Alp U.

description:
Really good burritos!
bad service and dirty af 
Short and simple.
But still good place to go and grab some lunch.
author: Ohad K.

description:
My first impression of this place: DIRTY!

I get that this is a hole-in-the-wall Mexican restaurant, and I shouldn't judge these type of places on the atmosphere. But oh my... the garbage on the floor, tables, and bathrooms made me feel uncomfortable, to the point where I wanted to finish my burrito quickly and get out.

That said, the burrito I had here is very good, and I can see why it's a popular late night spot to hit up after the bars. Next time, I either need to be more drunk to dine here and not care about the cleanliness, or order to-go.
author: Allan S.

description: Definitely the spot to go after a night of drinking at the bars nearby. It doesn't matter what time of the day or night you go for a quick fix of Mexican food. They always deliver the same consistent taste!
author: David T.

description:
I was visiting SF from Texas, so I'm always looking for the next authentic Mexican meal. During my stay, I've come back to El Farolito multiple times because its just that good! 5/5 just because the food here is so bomb, so lets "taco" bout it! 

First off, There is always a line, so expect a wait. It is also CASH only. 
Green salsa is to die for -- not too spicy, but just enough of a kick to it. I've tried the burrito, steak tacos, quesadilla, and chips. The quesadilla was a huge portion, but it had a little bit too much cheese and sour cream for my liking (but was still very tasty). The burrito was a great option for something filling and a taste of everything if you wanted the whole rice, beans, meat, sauce combo. The tacos were my all-time favorite, and I have come back multiple times just to eat this -- there is a generous portion of tender meat, with a roaring amount of flavor with each bite. Again, the green salsa is milder than the red, but a lot creamier in consistency. The chips were different in a nice way. They have a crunchier, thicker texture, rather than the usual flimsy thin kind that I am used to having.

It is open till 3AM on weekend nights, so a good place to eat after a late night out. The only downsides may be that the bathrooms are really unclean, and the tables are not really kept well (but I didn't really have much of an expectation).
author: Eugenia C.

description:
I love their carne asada burrito with refined beans. As you wait in the line, watch how glorious the burrito making process is: generous amount of avocado, cheese, sour cream, meat...

I tell myself to try something different every time but somehow I always end up with a burrito. Tried the cow head burrito and the carne asada burrito. I think cowhead is too tender and gelatinous for everyday, go for the carne asada for a classic flavor.

Location: Right next to 24th st mission bart, very accessible if you're a tourist.
author: Julia C.

description: I rarely go out to the city, but the last time I did I went here for a burrito. I remembered it and told myself that when I am in the area, I will get two more. And so I came here last night and this morning I am still smiling. This place can't disappoint. The line was already out the door and curving down the sidewalk. I could see mounds of delicious juicy tender meats ready for consumption in a burrito or tacos (of course they have other types of Mexican cuisine but thats all I seen people get).  I chose the giant shrimp and carne asada burrito and a super carne asada burrito in case I didn't like the shrimp. Get it with the shrimp! Huge pieces, grilled to perfection and loaded with flavor. Surf and turf had a war in my mouth and I was winning. Their refried beans are more on the creamy side which I love and the rice is the best Spanish rice I've had. The coolness of the sour cream and thick cut slices of avocado balances out the piping hot meaty goodness and giant tortilla. The only downside is that this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Joseph C.

description:
Great authentic Mexican food that's open late. 
With live mariachi band playing in the background. 
This was the perfect way to end the day. 
Full belly and a smile on my face. 
I had a burrito, and that thing was massive!
They also have amazing fresh salsa to accompany your meal.
author: Grester T.

description:
Going against the grain here, but the burrito was alright not out of this world. Hefty for sure though; if you eat the entire thing I hope you're metabolism is very quick or you'll surely induce some level of food coma.

I wasn't surprised to see the long line when we came, but it moved fairly quickly. Recommend taking to go or scouring for a table while one person with you stands in line. Tables are limited and during lunch on a weekend it was packed. The four strollers with some kind of new parent group that day didn't help at all either.

Carne Asada Super Burrito was good, but the Carnitas was on the dry side. Maybe I just need to try the Super Suiza (quesadilla)?
author: Lindsey C.

description:
I'm from SoCal all my life and lived in San Diego a good portion of it.
I would go to Tijuana, Mexico all the time just to get Mexican food too.
Since I have moved up to the Bay last year, I have not found a good Mexican restaurant until a few nights ago, at about 1am, I drive by and see this place open, went on Yelp and saw the reviews and the quantity as well.
I had to try it.
NO REGRETS!
The BEST Mexican food out here.
There IS hope for the Bay.
I ate their Chorizo super burrito, and all pastor tacos.
I can't wait to go back!
I wish they had Tamales, I don't recall seeing on their menu or Yelp menu, but if they have it, I look forward to trying it next time I go!
author: Richard M.

description: The food is so good.  Their burrito is big and it's so delicious.  I got the carne asada burrito and I love it.  The meat was moist and tender.  There is a long line and it's worth the wait.  Their chip is good as well
author: Quynh N.

description: I definitely recommend​ El Farolito it's​ my favorite Mexican​ restaurant and I've​ been to many Mexican​ restaurants. I love everything that I have tried there. My go-to is definitely the carne asada super burrito w/ everything except cilantro, onion, pico de gallo and instead of guac i choose avocado. The carne asada tacos and the carne asada meal is great too. If you like seafood I recommend​ the shrimp super quesadilla. I guess I could say I'm​ just a regular​ carne asada fan(lol).
author: Maria V.

description: Al pastor tacos are the best!! I got 1 al pastor and 1 carne asada, next time will get 2 al pastor cus the carnde asada was only okay. The al pastor is crispy and flavorful, I was sober when I had it. Only downside is onion breath afterward.
author: Patricia P.

description:
Ever had those moments where it's like midnight and you're craving tacos? Happened to me. I feel like any time after midnight is taco time. And where can you get tacos after midnight? El farolito

I like this place because they open until 2 am and I get hungry at weird hours. CASH ONLY, remember to bring cash. That's kinda annoying. 

I'm not a fan of burritos so I usually only get the tacos here. Their tacos are pretty solid, i've had really good tacos in San Antonio, TX and El Farolito is comparable. My favorite is the al pastor and the grilled chicken. How do they get the flavors to be so good? Also, they cook the meat just right where it's almost burnt but not yet, like.. Perfectly charred. They also pack these tacos with a bunch of meat, two tacos should be good enough to keep you full. 

I LOVE THEIR GREEN SAUCE!! Get the green sauce. I put it on everything, in my tacos and in my chips.
author: Yen P.

description:
My favorite thing I ate in San Fran, hands down. So good, I made sure we visited twice.

The pastor super burrito had the perfect proportion of ingredients (rice, beans, cheese, sour cream, guac, salsa, onion, cilantro, meat) and the flavors are so good! The meat is cooked perfectly, moist but charred, and seasoned well. It pairs well with the green salsa. The burrito is massive, and we left full splitting one. 

The restaurant is small and it may be hard to get a table that seats more than four people. This place is cash only!!
author: Kathy D.

description: Def recommend the super quesadilla! Cash only here, so make sure to stop by an ATM. I'm not usually a shrimp person when eating mexican food but I just might have to try a shrimp taco or burrito next time because it looked so good! Horchata was also yummy. :)
author: Vivian D.

description:
TLDR - go to burrito in SF for the late night grub

Get it! Best spot for sure for a late night and even a guilty day time pleasure. My buddy guy and I came here and went halvsies on a quesadilla and carne asada burrito. They were both bomb but i personally prefer the burrito.

It's got some character - there was a homie walkin around with a guitar and he serenaded us. It would of been cute if we were there on a chill food run with an S/O but we are just homies.

Good area to run in to people at. I ran in to a girl from my high school outside it.

WAYYY better than la taq
author: Samraaj B.

description: This place is a no nonsense Mexican joint!  Simple, delicious and rich.  People can't get enough of this place. The kitchen is open concept so you can see, hear and smell all the goodness coming from the chefs.  The salsa serving Station is the real deal.  This establishment was to crowded so I good my burrito to go!
author: Amorsolo D.

description: Mind you, this review is coming from a Torontonian where most (this is changing) of our Mexican (or even Tex-Mex) food is of the hipster/Taco Bell variety. Also, on a previous visit, I tried "La Taqueria" which many people also rave about but I was so underwhelmed with the "mission burrito", I kind of cried and vowed never to come back. But then, like Star Wars 4, there was "A New Hope"...And I'm soo glad I came back! Got the carne asada super nachos and chorizo super burrito. Paid a buck more to get each of them "super" which means they add sour cream, cheese, and avocado. It's well worth it. The nachos were F-R-E-S-H crispy with just the right amount of salt. And they're pretty generous with the toppings. They also do a good job of layering and distributing the toppings so you just don't have them all sitting at the top and you're left with naked chips at the end. The burrito was just as excellent: HUGE, packed, and full of FLAVOR! Bonus: it's on Mission St which has so much beautiful character. Caution: like many places in SF, parking can be sparse so plan to do a little walking but weekday afternoon wasn't so bad.
author: Jay F.

description: Good  food! Helpful staff and a lot of food. We sent there every day during 4 days :)
author: Giorgi K.

description:
Parking: It's the city; so nothing untypical. We found parking less than 0.3 miles away. 

Ambience: It's a hole-in-the-wall type of feel. I didn't mind it at all considering I could smell all the meats! So yum! 

Service: Employees were prompt (nothing stood out to me); they took our order and called our number when the food was ready. There was a line when we got there, but the service was fast so we wait no more than 20 minutes to order. 

Order: We ordered a steak quesadilla ($7.15) with sour cream and guac on the side.  

Verdict: 4 because the portions were generous and the meat was seasoned well. We order a side of guac; typically, you are given a Chipotle size amount but this place gave us like 3 or 4 times that amount (so lots of guac with every quesadilla bite). The ambiance is suited for late night eating and experience is solely on the food (and not environment). 

It's a must try especially after a late night of drinking! Cheers, friends. :)
author: Michelle B.

description:
authentic mexican food! 
and priced really well
i wish i got the burrito but it was so much food
i got two tacos - chicken and steak
so, i will say the flavor was lacking but i added salsa and it was perfect 
i also tried chips and guacamole and the chips were freshly made and perfect 
lots of options to sit down too
salsa bar is self serviced
author: Neha M.

description: Huge portions and very affordable! The seating area is cramped and out of date, but the food more than makes up for it. Great late night meal.
author: Joe J.

description:
I feel like a disappointment to my fellow Bay Area natives for never coming to El Farolito until last weekend. I was at a party in the Mission and TBH planned on going to La Taq until I realized it was almost midnight and it was closed, thus ended up wandering over to El Farolito. The line was out the door and I was surprised by how slowly we moved, took about 30 minutes in total before we got our food.

I got my go-to, a carne asada super burrito. The portion was generous especially for the price, I ate half that night and the rest the next day. I'm a big baby when it comes to spice, so I was sure to ask for mild salsa when I ordered. But when the guy at the register repeated my order he spoke super fast and it sounded like he might have said "light" salsa? Anyway when I got my burrito it looked like mild salsa/pico de gallo but holy heck it was really spicy. Like I said I'm a wimp and it wasn't so spicy it was inedible, but it definitely made me enjoy my burrito less.

As everyone else said this place is pretty dirty if you care about that. The floor, the tables, the bathroom were all straight up grimy, but we took it to-go so we didn't have to deal. 

Overall this is a good alternative to La Taq's crazy expensive $13 burrito. I'd come here again, but definitely gotta figure out this "mild" salsa situation first!
author: Tracy C.

description:
Review Rating: 5/5

You don't know how many times I've came here for their super burrito. I always get the chicken or steak super burrito. The burrito is huge. Everytime I order, I could never finish it. I always save the other half for later.

Wait times: 3/5 

If you're planning to get a quick lunch and you're hungry at the same time, oh boy you got a long time to wait. The line gets super long and once you order, there is barley any room to wait for your burrito. 

Overall: 5/5. Why? It's the super burrito. That super burrito made my quick lunch time a whole lot better. For under $10.00, where will I find another burrito that is huge and will make me full for the entire night? 

Forgot to mention, they give a lot of meats and toppings. The burrito deserved a 5/5 on the spot.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: My husband and I fly to San Francisco mostly just for these burritos. Carne asada is the best. Don't worry, the line moves fast. Sometimes it can be hard to get a seat. There is a Bart stop on the same block so it is so easy to get there.
author: Brooklyn D.

description: Without a doubt, everyone needs to go eat at El Farolito. It's one of those order at the counter and find your own seat establishments, but it's well worth the wait you'll likely have to do and stand in line. All of the portions are gigantic, so unless you're incredibly hungry and have been known to kill TWO Chipotle burritos at some point in your life, I highly recommend splitting a burrito or quesadilla with a friend and get a side of chips and salsa. If you're a cheese lover, you won't be disappointed by the quesadilla. It's creamy, gooey, and delicious. A burrito is a little easier to eat since the sides are tucked in, but generally has all the same ingredients. Don't forget to get your order a SUPER burrito or SUPER quesadilla. It's worth it.
author: Sally Y.

description:
If you're ever in the city and craving some mexican food this is one of the places you should stop by at! 
Good portion for the amount of money you're paying! You get a HUGE portion for your moneys worth. 

Parking is always crazy on mission street but the service was fast when I came here on a Sunday afternoon. I came in at a good time where the line starting to build up right after I ordered. 

I ordered a super quesadilla with carne asada. It was HUGE and I only paid around 7 bucks for it. I even shared it with my boyfriend so it's good enough for two people who want a bigger snack. It'll keep you content and full for a while. The meat was just so fresh and it didn't lack flavor at all. 

Overall good portion for a great price for great food!
author: Maricris C.

description:
As much as I love their humungo burritos here and quite tasty, I'm not sure if this is a place I'd return to considering how they treat the homeless people here.

If a customer orders for a person who hasn't eaten for 3 days and pays for it, you would think that the staff would honor it. However this wasn't the case and I felt quite humiliated. To the staff member who actually took down my order for the fella and then had the balls to cross it out, bad move dude. The lines took so long that I ended up having to share half of my own order because I felt so bad. 

Please treat all with respect and dignity.
author: Jia Qi F.

description: Excellent food and hopping atmosphere. Worth the wait of standing in line. Authentic and fresh with huge portions. Caution -they accept CASH ONLY! And you may not get a seat so be prepared to carry out. But it is an experience you don't want to miss!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Definitely my favorite mex place in the city

You'd think they'd all be good! 

You have to wait in that dreadful line, starving...watching them cook the meat, prepare your food behind the glass....getting more hungry

And then you have to wait more for your food to be done because it's so busy and this place is the place to go!

It's definitely worth it in the end. They call your # and deliver it right to you.
author: Lynn C.

description:
California Mexican food is LIFE.  There's nothing like it outside of California.  Depending on where your taste buds take you, El Farolito is a good place to start and definitely to try out for visitors.  Their menu is pretty large and diverse but stick to a quesadilla or burrito and you won't regret it.  Every time I've had a burrito or quesadilla from El Farolito, I always notice that the meat is a lot more fresher than some other places.  Their portion is pretty Cali-sized so definitely have an appetite when you go! Or save it for later, of course. The ingredients they put in their burritos seem very authentic and traditional as well. 

I usually get their carne asada but recently I've been venturing off to their tripe and lengua.  All very great cuts.  The portion of meat in the burrito does not come shy.  There's a LOT in there. So eat up and enjoy living the beautiful California dream of having amazing Mexican food.

Cash only!
author: Tiffany Z.

description: The blonde guy in the front is really bad at taking orders. Messed up my order twice and did not offer to replace the wrong order. Highly disappointed. Although the food is good, customer service is horrible.
author: Shamal L.

description:
Authentic and delicious! I was so excited to try this place during my limited time in San Francisco due to not only the amount of great yelp reviews this place has, but also TACOS! Tacos on corn tortillas! This place is definitely pick and go place. It has seating on the side and back but definitely a place of quick, cheap casual eating where they take your order, then move down the line to pay.

I got the carnitas and lengua (beef tongue) tacos. Both had plenty of meat on the delicious soft, heated corn tortilla. Both were super tender and full of flavor. There was no shortage of cilantro and the sauces were the perfect complement to the taco. So good! I also had to get the quesadilla which was gigantic in size, wrapped with crisp flour tortilla. The sour cream, beef, cheese and seasoning was also very delicious. Plenty to share with friends.

Overall, great for quick, delicious and easy meal.
author: Michelle L.

description: Leguna leguna leguna leguna. Nachos are good. So are the quesadillas. Beer is cheap. Prices are fair especially for SF.
author: Dillon D.

description: Been here too many times to count. Only checked in 47 of those times. Recommendations: be okay if your table isn't perfectly clean. This is a high volume spot. Get over yourself and enjoy the best carne asada super quesadilla in San Francisco or a carnitas super burrito.
author: Michael M.

description: My favorite burrito spot in SF. I always get the steak super burrito. Cash only and usually busy.
author: Michelle B.

description:
We started off trying another place that was recommended, but it was closed so we searched for the nearest place with the best reviews (that was open). El Farolito, perfect. 

I have to say, don't expect this to be your trendy taco shop. There's a line, a million people bump into you, it's narrow to walk through, it's not clean.... but aside from that, my burrito was delicious. My boyfriend and I got the surf and turf and a special burrito that had el pastor (pork) and shrimp annnd a lot of other tasty things. We loved them both, he was more partial to the carne asada and I preferred the pastor, but we enjoyed them both. 

The entire block is lined with Mexican restaurants. I wouldn't mind coming here again, but most likely Would try a new place next time.
author: Brittany N.

description: This place was okay. The tacos were greasy and a bit bland for my taste. The ambience was good, laid back and lively. I wouldn't go out of my way to go there but if I were in the neighborhood I'd go back and try a burrito... they looked yummy
author: Grace D.

description:
I haven't finished my burrito yet, but I'm already writing about it because I'm sitting at SFO with a 1.5 hour flight delay kicking myself in the head wondering why I didn't check out El Farolito earlier on in my trip so I could get it more than once. It's okay though, I'll be back. Yeah, it's that good. I grew up in Houston, so amazing Mexican food isn't hard to come by, but omfg El Farolito is so freaking delicious.

I ordered an al pastor super burrito, and it was delivered to me in less than 10 minutes. I also beat the rush (around 12:30pm). The burrito is hugeeeeeeeee. This burrito is just a huge explosion amazing flavors that go so well together. The more I bite into it, the more I fall in love.

I can't wait to come back and try the tacos and more burritos.
author: Elain T.

description:
EVENT: been drinking? Lunch break? Maybe you just got off work? Or you're just feeling some delish food cause all u can think of is El Farolito in your dreams and daydreams at work! Gotta get some!! Ahs!

PARKING: don't brother... you will find nothing

SERVICE: no matter what time u go.... there's a huge as line... massive line... but goes by quickly! Line up and when u get to the counter.... wooo-laaa place ur order! How easy is that! Do want to remind u ...**CASH ONLY** bring cash or have ur friend spot u and Venmo them! 

FOOD:
(1) Super burrito - massive! Lots of meat, beans, and juices! You'll be dropping it all off on ur first bite!!
(2) Regular taco with carnitas! Carnitas - so juicy and salty! Flavorful! Add some salsa and avocado sauce on to it... and BAM! Food coma!

DRINKS: of course coke in a bottle is a must! 

**OVERALL: you bet... coming back for more! 5 stars!
author: Mindy Y.

description: This place is beyond amazing, don't let the area fool you they make a mean delicious out of this world true mission burrito. I have to say I was skeptical as soon as we got out of the uber, walked across the street, and walked to a total hole in the wall. The best whole in the wall, made with love kind of food place. It was about 11am on a Friday morning, super hung over from the night before when my best friend and I stumbled upon this hidden gem from all the local yelpers. Thank you yelpers!! We were in the mood for trying that day - trying every food joint in town so we shared the carne asada burrito and he had the carne asada taco and coke came to about $18 and some change. P.s don't share and don't try, just eat. I will be back!!
author: Tawny V.

description: The burritos are amazing, but the floor plan is awful.  It's this long skinny area that you have to squeeze through, and the line is always out the door and around the block because the food is so good.  Pro tip: go to the 24th/Alabama Street location instead.  Same amazing food, better floor plan, fewer people.
author: Christian J.

description: Order my special 3 meat burrito and it never disappoints. Love this place, highly recommend!!!
author: Amber O.

description:
I feel this place is more of a drunk food kinda place since its close to so many bars and clubs and its open till late. 

The food was average - nothing amazing. The awesome rating is mostly based on the drunk crowd or the college kids who get hungry after midnight.
author: Rupa S.

description:
4.5/5 

I love El Farolito, this little establishment brings back high school memories. Although I have to admit, my exposure to Mexican food has increased by a tenfold since those days. I grew from not liking Mexican food (think 1 - 2x per year) to having cravings for it. The burritos here are phenomenal and their horchatas are great. However, I have to say I was a bit disappointed with their tacos. The carnitas tacos I ordered were a bit on the dry side which I found weird since carnitas are known to be somewhat juicy. But hey, I can still scarf down an entire burrito by myself here so works out for me! I've also never really had a bad experience here for almost a decade besides having a hard time finding seats. The line for the food is always intense. :)
author: Denise L.

description:
This is probably one of the best places in San Fransisco that I have to come to, to get my Mexican food craving fix! This place honestly never disappoints. 

I've had the nachos, the quesadillas but nothing compares to the mouth watering yumminess of the chicken torta !!!  

I recommend any one who comes here to get the chicken torta with some horchata!! 

Only downside is that they only except CASH! So don't forget to bring cash
author: Paulina A.

description:
You can't go wrong with anything you order here! 

One weekend, I decided to try all the top rated taco establishments in The Mission and this one won by a long shot. MUST TRY. Steak, El Pastor, Chicken, ANYTHING - you gotta get it here. Friends also tried their burritos and quesadilla and raves about it.

Also, #KaskadeApproved
author: Ida H.

description: Hands down to the best quesadilla I have ever had. The tortilla is crunchy. The cheese is flavorful. The meat is well cooked. Highly recommend.
author: Big B.

description: Gr8tist place we loved itwe had a really good burrito it was so cool 10/10 would recommend
author: Lisa k.

description:
The wait wasn't too bad during a Saturday night at 8, but definitely one of the busier places on that street. 

Tacos: They were soo big for tacos! Definitely had a lot of flavor in the meat, which is usually rare in taco meat. Thankful for all the side sauces they offer as well! It goes perfectly with the tacos. 

Lengua Nachos: Kinda soggy, once we got it back to the hotel but the layers were perfect. There was a lot of lengua in it, which is usually rare when it comes to having meat in nachos. The cheese, jalapeños, avocados, beans were all layered perfectly. 

Ceviche: Had better ceviche elsewhere, but this was definitely fresh. It was kind of over seasoned meaning it was quite salty and sour for my taste. If it was toned down a bit, I think it would be perfect.
author: Carol T.

description: Love love love love love their boiled chicken.
author: Amy O.

description:
The price was great! But, the food was okay. A lot of rice and beans in the super burrito. Barely tasted the sour cream or avacado. 

Would go back, if I'm around the area.
author: Denise A.

description: Finally got around to trying the place. Everyone talks about this place and if you get a chance to stand in their line, you'll see why. It was about a 30 minute wait, but we got to see the guys cooking through the window. We ordered a carnitas supreme burrito and an asada supreme. My husband really wanted to try the quesadilla Suiza, but we ended up not ordering one. We also had each of the salsas. My husband liked them, but I was really disappointed that none of them were spicy at all. What pushed this review to 4-stars is their use of fresh avocados in their good AND the size/affordability. We took our food to go, even though there was plenty of seating inside.  Big turn-off: the condition of the place; there was garbage and spills everywhere. Would come again and take it to go.
author: Diana G.

description: Half carne asada and pastor quesadilla.  8/10. Pretty salty but it's still pretty good for the their speed and price.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
This restaurant sells cheap, delicious burritos that are prepared really quickly and cost around $6 - 8 for each burrito. This place is really small and therefore usually doesn't have a lot of seats, so expect to get take out or if you're really lucky you might get a seat. This place also doesn't accept card, so prepare to pay with cash. When it's really busy, it actually takes some time to get your food, so it might be slower than going to other places around here.

Their burritos don't come with rice, like some other places, instead they feel more loose with more beans and meat, but I feel they can pack their burritos more because it's so loose that sometimes things begin to fall out of the burrito and it begins to fall apart and gets quite messy.
author: Christopher L.

description: Oh, you want some BIG DELICIOUS MEXICAN? Well here it is! This place is absurdly good value. The food is satiating, and they give you SO much of it. I'm only knocking a star off for the cleanliness of the inside and the layout of the place: the line is often too long for you to actually see the whole menu before you have to order.
author: Sofie G.

description: This a CASH ONLY place. Two people could easily share a burrito, they're huge and delicious. We got burritos and a quesadilla, both very good! The chips are amazing. If you can, hurry and snag a table to eat at since seating is limited.
author: Madison M.

description: El Farolito is a San Francisco institution. It is a no frills Mexican restaurant. You order at the counter and there's a good mix of people taking their food to go and eating inside the restaurant. It is cash only and is on the more expensive side for a quick burrito spot. I had a shrimp burrito and horchata for $16.
author: Lauren B.

description: Best burrito ever!  This is my new favorite burrito shack. Just follow the line of people waiting to get in. Just look thru the front window at the guy cooking mounds of steak and pork and chicken on the griddle. Just see the enormous tubs of salsa mixed at the counter. We ordered -- what else -- burritos! My al pastor super burrito was bursting with flavors of marinated pork and tomato and onion and rice and beans. This place packs on the heat.  My burrito was hot and juicy and slightly greasy. Wow !
author: Charles L.

description:
Looking at all those 5 star reviews and just wondering... How?

To start with, this place is located on a dirty street with bunch of homeless hanging around and making me feel uncomfortable. And the taqueria itself is not the cleanest place in the world.

The second thing I want to talk about is Cash only policy. Seriously?? It's the 21st century!!! Plus, why would I want to carry cash in this kind of location?

The food was not bad but I can't say it was good. Somewhere between meh and ok. The chicken in my burrito was dry and a bit over cooked. Everything else like beans, rice, guac, sour cream and spicy sauce mixed together and made a good taste, however, the chicken made me hate that burrito. Despite everything, definitely worth the money you pay.

And the last thing I want to talk about is service. As I mentioned before, this location is not the greatest in San Francisco, and I'm pretty sure that service has to be worth coming in this area. No, El Farolito employees don't even care about you. (I don't speak Spanish, so may be that is an issue.) It could be cleaner inside. They want you to come in, pay cash and leave.

I wouldn't recommend coming here alone. For a small group of people should be OK.
author: Mark K.

description: Delicious, quick Mexican food. Line was long and it's cash only. We enjoyed our burritos. It was fairly crowded and we had to wait for a seat to open.
author: Tara G.

description:
The food here was perfect for a late night snack. We went late night and there was a pretty long line. The cleanliness of this establishment was the worst part of the experience, but also, when you have that many customers at that hour it's hard to bus tables.
The food was pretty fast once you ordered and everybody around had these canisters of green hot sauce. We tried it and it was great! 
Some things to consider, they have a jukebox and when someone plays it, it gets really loud. This can be annoying for some
People. Also, late night is not the best time to go if you are not among the crew of late nighters (as it is full of people that have been out hanging in the city, looking for some grub to cure a hangover.) but not everyone there was part of the crew! We certainly enjoyed the experience, and the burritos and tacos are a great price if you need your local Mexican fix.
author: Jonna Leanne P.

description: Amazing Mexican food! I got the Quesadilla SUIZA both times here and this last time my fiancé got the burrito with steak. The steak in the Quesadilla is seasoned very well and it's not your typical Quesadilla. The portions are nice and big and this place is inexpensive. It's a no frills a, cash only kinda place and that is the best! I recommend this when looking for Mexican food in the Mission.
author: Priya S.

description:
I've been eating here since 2002 and their quality has been amazing since and hasn't wavered by a smidgen.

I've only ever eaten their burrito, tacos and torta once, and that was because I ordered each item at individual instances along with their super quesadilla suiza.

Their super quesadilla suiza is the greatest food on this planet. It is so good, in fact, that if someone put a gun to my head and said I could have one last meal before I die, I'd ask for the super quesadilla suiza with carnitas and carne asada.

Forget my grandmother's food.

Forget my mother's food. 

As amazing as their food is, I would take this quesadilla over anything else in the world. I'm literally sitting in my home in Los Angeles, dreaming and drooling over this right now.
author: Sargon O.

description: The burritos are really good here, they are also very big so come with a friend or a big appetite. We also try the complete meal but it was a little bland. Something in the burrito, probably the sauce that gives it a good kick. I love how laid back the place is. You get online, you order, you pay and you sit and enjoy your meal. Reminds me of NYC pizza places except they serve mexican food. They are also open real late so after bar hopping in the mission district, this is a great place to have a meal.
author: Ann S.

description:
El farolito gets crowded but there's ample seating--expect lines out the door for sure. It's probably doing well because 1) cheap 2) open late night 3) has hella options. Besides that the food is nothing special in my opinion. 

I've tried their burrito and alambre. Not too impressed with their extra cheese on everything. 

The alambre steak was rather tough but flavors were alright--definitely way more peppers/onions than meat (how am I supposed to get big without my steak tho). 

I don't like burritos in general because it's basically rice, beans, tortilla, and I need my daily dose of fiber, but some burritos are tolerable--el farolito's is not. I got the super carne asada burrito but for 80% of the burrito I felt like I was basically eating a plain old bean and cheese burrito, 10% of the burrito was the tortilla and 10% just random pockets of guac/sour cream/dry carne asada. I also had to sauce it up because it wasn't juicy enough for me. I've definitely had better at other locations and food trucks (i.e., mora) for maybe $1 more which is worth it!

I'm a fan of their chips and salsa though--that stuff is addicting!
author: Lydia Z.

description:
Came here last night and I dont know what it is but their food tastes so good!
Their ingredients just seem more flavorful than other Mexican food places! Definitely gonna come back next time I am in SF!
author: Abe B.

description:
Absolutely dynamite burrito. For now, I'm going to call it the best I've had - no joke! 

There's no shortage of taqueria options in The Mission, but this one was recommended to me by a local while visiting. The only bad thing I can say is that it may have ruined Mexican food for me back home! :p. I can't say how this compares to the other options nearby, but I can tell you that there's no going wrong with this one.

Pro tip: Bring cash!
author: Andrew K.

description:
It's cheap Mexican food that's open late. Apparently it is the best in the Mission (but I wouldn't discount other taquerias just because this one has a bit of fame to it).

The super quesadilla is soooo good! The default photo for El Farolito is that and dude, it's so worth! The portions are huge. I ate half of it the night of drinking and the other half for lunch the next day. SO GOOD.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I've had several friends tell me to try El Farolito and I finally got a chance.  The first thing I noticed was the line coming-out of this little Taqueria, which told me that it's one popular place.  As the line entered the Taqueria, you could see the staff hard at work filling all the orders at a very quick pace.  I was really happy to see how quickly the line moved.

We waited patiently after we ordered for a table.  I was happy, when a gentleman finished-up and offered his table to us.  I was impressed how quickly they were able to serve as many patrons as they did in such a timely fashion.  

I ordered the Super Carne Asada Burrito and the first thing that crossed my mind was how big it was.  Not to mention, it was loaded with very tasty ingredients.  My burrito had a good amount of sour cream, but was a bit light on avocado.  However, the flavor of the burrito was delish.  One of my friends ordered the Super Burrito with Tripe and Lengua, that she said was awesome.  

I'm glad I had a chance to come here after all the positive feedback I've received.
author: Lon H.

description: Finally had my first mission burrito and I'm a fan! On my first trip here I got the carne asada and al pastor super burrito, along with a lengua and cabeza taco to go. There was of course a line out the door, but it moved steadily (I wouldn't say speedily). My family isn't normally big on burritos but everybody loved these. They are....massive. Great flavor and packed with a ton of stuff. We got the food to go, and tbh it was crowded inside and eating out was probably way easier. The place is very casual and you're kind of on your own to clean and buss your own tables. Couldn't find any street parking in the area hence getting the food to go!
author: Peggy C.

description:
Asked for chips 3x time after paying for it,and they wouldn't give it

Otherwise good food, get the quesadilla
author: Abhay D.

description:
This is classic mission burrito. Have been here many nights past midnight and without fail there is a line.

Lengua is delicious if you have never had it. Add chips for less than a dollar!
author: Kevin Y.

description: Super good and cheap! I got two tacos (chicken and chorizo) and liked both. The chorizo one was oily so I don't think I'd get it again. My friend got the enchilada plate and didn't really like it as it was sweeter than she was expecting it to be. It's cash only so make sure you have cash and watch out for the random pigeon walking around. :)
author: Mira B.

description:
Legit best place to get burritos, nachos, ANYTHING in San Francisco that is all Mexican and AUTHENTIC Mexican! 
Super super super good :)
author: Justin S.

description:
I should probably stop complaining at this point but oh wells, might as well be my last one.  

As a born and raised San Franciscan, this area back in the days...let's just say I wouldn't be here at 11:30pm....unless I am in a car bulletproof and what not.

Of course, now it's the rage!  Oh mission, so cool!  

Anyways, brought my SO here to have a go at this joint since I used to always go to the one in SSF back when I was working near there.  The SSF one, delicious! Here I am, Saturday night, close to midnight.  I told my SO, that I'm not too comfortable being around here at this hour (he's a New Yorker).  But what do I see? Line out of the door with a whole bunch of frat boys and party goers....all I wanted was to grab a burrito, hot off the grill top and call it a night but no, fate said no.

 After what felt like forever ( ok 30 min) We ordered and grab a table to eat a little.  You would think it would kill someone if they clean up their own mess but again, who am I kidding? 

Ok, stop complaining, my burrito, maybe cuz it's a busy night but it was bland.  Even with the sauce, it didn't taste right.  I think I was lacking the fat from the meat or something but it was dry.  The rice was a bit hard and my carne asada was on the drier end.  Yea my sad face came out.  His did too.  Here he was, super excited for a burrito.  Failed

I would just make my way to the SSF location or just another joint.  Oh yeah, cash only....at this point of gentrification, add a credit card option please!
author: Laurie W.

description: Definitely one of my favorite places to come for a quick bite in San Francisco.  Large variety on the menu and all items are priced well.  I get the super burrito with carne asada which costs around $8-$9.  The super burrito comes with your choice of meat, avocado, rice, pinto, sour cream, cheese, and you can add your choice of salsas.  The line may look long but usually goes by fast, good service, and plenty of tables available.  Will be coming back soon!
author: Matthew F.

description: I love how this place closes late! A Lyft driver recommended this place to us and since I am a big fan of mexican food, I had to try it out. I came during rush hour but the line went by pretty quickly. My friends and I ordered tacos and they were huge! I could barely finish two! The carne asada and al pastor were super delicious here. They also have a hot sauce bar. Just a reminder, this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
In the never-ending guerra between Casa Farolito and Casa Taqueria, I pledge my allegiance to Señor Farolito, First of His Name, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, Protector of the Realm, and rightful heir to the Iron Throne. All hail the King in the Mission!

Affordably priced at $7.75, El Farolito's behemoth of a super burrito is loaded with explosive juicy goodness. I ordered the half pollo / half carne asada and cried tears of joy with every bite. They really nailed the ratio between meats, guacamole, and sour cream.

Keep in mind, however, that there is nothing fancy about this place whatsoever. The crowd is rowdy, the seats are dirty, and the food comes in flimsy plastic containers.
