I wish they'd drain some of the sauce out. Luckily, the burrito held it's shape and didn't tear.

I also had the horchata to drink which was super smooth and not powdery like most taquerias. 

The food did take a while to come out but they offered chips and salsa (from the salsa bar) which was great while we waited.

The taqueria is a little small. There is plenty of seating but it can get a little tight when you come in a group of 4+.

They have one restroom which I don't find all that clean. There are two sinks outside with no mirrors which sucks because you can't see if you have cilantro or chicken stuck in your teeth.

Overall the food was great. Just be sure to carry cash around if you decide to eat here!
author: Love K.

description:
I've been here twice on weekend night. It's crazy.
The food is bomb. The quesadilla suiza is really good. Burritos are really good. 
The only drawbacks here are that it's chaos in there sometimes. The line on a weekend night at 2am is crazy. However, it does move quicker than you'd think. 
It's cash only, so that sucks. The ATM outside charges you like 3 bucks, if it even has money. 
It's pretty loud, so you need to pay attention if you want to hear your order get called. 
The seating is awkward too. Small tables packed into the small place... 
Despite all of that, it's definitely a good spot for good Mexican food.
author: Fernando B.

description: This one of my favorite taquerias in SF. I have zero complaint about their food. I dont care to dine in I just wonna grab my grub to go. The quesadilla pada dose and the super burrito (steak or chicken) is fire!! Ive only been able to stop by after a night out, maybe I will try them for lunch!!
author: Wilbert L.

description:
The sheer number of options and selections here were massive. I definitely was overwhelmed but there is something on the menu for everyone.

The burritos were humongous and couldn't even finish it and I usually clean up my friend's dishes, so there was definitely some heft to it.
author: Raymond W.

description: Pretty good late night classic mexican favorites. Not much in the way of ambience like most Mission area small businesses. Cash Only!!
author: Sandie B.

description:
Heard a lot about this place when I came to SF. It is located right next to the 16th St Bart station. The food is super good! But it is cash only, so remember to bring cash.

When it's busy (which is almost all the time), it's very hard to find seats. If you're not good at hunting down seats, this place probably will be a little difficult if you're trying to eat here!
author: Do P.

description:
Ugh. El Farolito makes me miss California taquerias SO much. Gone are the days I lived in Southern California and ate bean, rice, and cheese burritos with amazing salsa, or simple carne asada tacos multiple times a week. 

I took some friends here for lunch, after popping out of the 24th St. Bart Station and they basically said it was the best damn carne asada they ever had. With beans and rice, and at less than $10, a steal. I went with the carne asada quesadilla suiza this time, and that thing was hefty enough for two meals. The tortilla was crisp and it was filled with gooey cheese, carne, avocado, and sour cream.

Cash only, and you may have to fight for a table, but it's worth it for some of the best/cheap Mexican food you've ever had.
author: Jonelle T.

description:
Late night Mexican food anyone? Hanging around the Mission and looking for a bite? RIGHT HERE!

CASH ONLY

Friends were raving how great this place was and how it was a must-try, so we tried it! There is STILL a line at 9pm at night (late night munchies for everybody, I guess).

LOCATION: Right next to the 24th St Mission BART station. Super convenient if you're taking the BART to/from and want to grab a bite.

DINE-IN: A few tables lined up for dine-in and they will call your order # and bring it to your table. Self-serve waters right by the cashier. There is also salsa that you can fill up in little containers right by the cashier - get your salsa fix!

You can also order to-go if you're in a rush or taking it back to nomz.

LINE: There will probably be a line when you get here (or maybe there won't be and you're lucky). The line moves pretty fast and you can see them make the food while you stand in line.

FOOD: From quesadillas to burritos to tacos to whatever you can think of, you won't be disappointed! I ordered a Super Burrito - SOOOO FILLING! I saved half of it for the next day. Still tasted delicious as a leftover. The quesadillas looked amazing too (may have to try that next time around).
author: Wing L.

description:
Ordered: Super Quesadilla Suiza; Tacos El Pastor
What to get: Super Quesadilla Suiza

First time we hit up this place was right after Smuggler's Cove. At that time, the line was out the door. The place is rather small, but a table clears up pretty fast.

Super Quesadilla Suiza: hugeee quesadilla, probably could serve two. It's really cheesy and the meat is savory. The tortilla is slightly crispy and the guac really does wonders.

Tacos El Pastor: marinated well, but, could get messy.
author: James N.

description: My pick for best Mission burrito. Flavourful, cheap and high volume. No pretenses, good hours, Farolito is the spot.
author: Calum Y.

description:
The lines are always out the door, but don't worry, the line moves fast.

El Farolito is comfort food for a late night junky like me. If I am not craving for pizza after a couple of beers, the next in line are burritos, tacos, or quesidillas, and thank goodness you can find all three here! Everything is delicious and I must say that it is one of the best burritos I've ever had in my life. I previously had their chicken quesidilla (crunchy tortilla with moist chicken), steak burrito (meat is a bit dry, but ask for refried beans and that makes all the difference), pork tacos (whoa, super juicy and the perfect portion. BTW it comes with 2 tacos), and lengua super burrito (SUPER juicy meat, might be the best I've had here!)

I would say that El Farolito is always a winner. The staff is extremely nice and they work hard to please. Their sauces are delicious and is a huge complimentary. If you and your friends decide to cram into their small tables, don't forget to tell them you are eating in house so they can call your number and bring your food to your table. By the way, it's CASH ONLY.

Enjoy!
author: Linda K.

description: Amazing burrito!  Tour guide recommended it and said it was one of the best he's ever had.  He wasnt joking.  Line was long for a monday night but worth it.
author: Erik H.

description: El Farolito is great if you're craving Mexican food! Definitely order the Super Carne Asada Burrito if you haven't tried it. The Quesadilla Super Suiza also looked freaking delicious and will have to try that the next time I come; they were making it as I was waiting in line and they were bigger than the size of my face. Oh yeah- and you can't have a burrito without drinking horchata. Get it. Remember this place is cash only and seating is super limited!
author: Grace L.

description: I still love el farolito and I still say they have the best burrito in town but...I have some concerns that I would like to share.  Years ago el farolito was not only the best burrito in the mission but it was also the cheapest.  Now it's on par with the rest of the mission in terms of price and is a bit smaller.  The super suiza appears to be quite smaller as well.  It always sucks when a restaurant has to make their product more profitable so I just hope this trend doesn't continue at el farolito!. Also, my burrito and my partners super suiza were both really spicy so I don't know if they're defaulting to spicy salsa.  I hope not because neither of us can handle spice like that.  Still my fave and I'll be back but I had to voice some troubling trends!
author: Lance D.

description: Regular carne asada burrito was absolutely delicious and worth trekking through the sketchy parts of the mission to purchase it. It comes with pinto beans but you might be able to replace it for black or refried beans. Nice ratio of meat to other ingredients (rice, beans, pico de gallo salsa) and the tortilla was soft and toothsome. Make sure to check out the serve yourself salsa bar for the green chili salsa and pickled veggies.
author: Julia K.

description: Best burrito in da city. The salsa will burn your face off, so proceed with caution.
author: Christy C.

description:
Oh el farolito.

The one I see after my drunken shenanigans, but don't worry, I come here when I'm sober too. It's just THAT good.

Besides that they close late at night, their food is cooked to perfection. I personally am not a fan of Mexican food or am really picky about it so I'm thankful to find a Mexican joint this close to me. My favorite dish of their's is the carne asada super quesadilla  OMG it's heavenly.

The quesadilla is cooked nice and crispy and the steak marinated nicely. Making every bite bursting with flavor. I also love their hot sauce.

My cousin got the steak burrito and that was delicious too! But I still highly recommend the quesadilla for that crispy tortilla. This is my go-to Mexican joint. When I'm craving a late night snack I'm always there!
author: Frances T.

description: Solid taco but nothing spectacular. The Al pastor was a bit tough and could have used a piece of pineapple or a bit more sweetness. They are known for the burrito, so maybe that is more breathtaking.
author: Jacob M.

description: Came around noon on a Saturday and line was out the door, but service was fast. The cashier even threw in free chips for me and my friend as consolation for waiting! The amount of food for the price here is insane. We ordered the quesadilla for two but it could honestly feed four. These are some of the best burritos and quesadillas you can find for this price range in the city and gems like this are becoming rarer and rarer here in SF.
author: Amy C.

description: So this wasn't quite recent, but two weeks ago I visited this great restaurant for their world famous French fries. I was a little disappointed though. Many of the French fries were soggy. I suppose some people would prefer this, but not me. I can't stand when the fries are moist, they give the fries an odd mouth-feel and the bouquet is just entirely off. I want my fries to be crispy, well salted, and not oily! I had to eat these with a fork to keep my hands at least a little clean. I couldn't even think about going near my iphone. When I made the mistake of touching the phone, it looked like a greasy faced child from the playground had rubbed up against it. They were totally filling though, so that at least was satisfying. 5/10 stars. I'd recommend El Farolito really work on their French fries meal!
author: Bill G.

description:
I stopped in on a whim this evening, and this burrito totally exceeded my expectations! Amazing!

I got the carne asada burrito, which was enormous and cheap. The meat was flavorful and tender, and there was a decent ratio of meat to rice and beans. If you don't want a burrito they had tacos, quesadillas, toastadas, etc. which also looked pretty good. 

There was a pretty long line but it moved quickly and orders were ready quickly, too. All the salsas from the salsa bar were great (especially the green one!). Cash only. 

It's pretty chaotic inside and not necessarily someplace I'd want to sit and eat for that reason, but the takeout is some of (if not the) best I've had in the Mission. Close to the BART station too.  Worth checking out!
author: Christine G.

description:
I really love the Super Quesadilla Suiza with carnitas. The meat is juicy and flavorful and the quesadilla is plump and filling. For about $8, it's fairly priced for SF.

That said, El Farolito is so dirty that even Yi Z., a girl who once lived in a third world country, finds it unbearable at times. Due to the volume of customers at night, you have to stalk other patrons to get a table that is never cleaned. Ladies, do not put your purse down either. When I thought it couldn't get any dirtier, I headed to the restroom and I was blown away (not in a positive way). I definitely regretted not using the restroom at the dive bar we were at earlier.

There must be other good Mexican places nearby. I'm tired of waiting in a long line in the cold SF wind for this experience.
author: Yi Z.

description:
There wasn't a wow factor for me when I ate it here, but I must say that their burritos were huge!

The line and the wait weren't bad at all. I ordered the breakfast burrito, and it came out in about 10 minutes. The only thing I thought about my burritos was that there was way too much rice in my burrito and not enough meat.

There's some sauce near the register to pour on your food. I tried two of the three and I thought the spicier salsa tasted great on my burrito.

Good bang for your buck.
author: Aj C.

description:
Probably not the best burrito place but the best burrito place at the wee hours of the night after a bit of drinking. This is a stuffy sweaty place with people eager to eat after a night at the bars. Long lines at certain late night hours - unbelievable. But that alone means they are doing something right.

I've got a theory that they design these burritos to be messy when you eat them regardless how sober you are. No matter what a burrito from here is guaranteed to get everywhere.

Conveniently near the 24th bart - one can see why this is a popular place.... and the tradeoff with waiting 10 or more minutes in line is that you almost get a guarantee that your food is fresh.
author: Stefan T.

description: Came here because of the 538.com America's best burritos articles. Fell in love *heart eyes*. Cash only.
author: Morgan G.

description: Wow, just wow. I got 3 tacos...Al Pastor, Chorizo, and Lengua, all of which were delicious. Did I already say wow? Can't believe I hadn't been here in my 5 years in the bay!
author: Jardin M.

description: Waited in line in the freezing cold for 20 minutes just to find a super angry cashier who was even more angry to find I didn't carefully examine their "cash only" signs. He said there was an ATM next door. He angrily cursed at the cashier machine, which hey, I get that's frustrating, but I apologize for forgetting this is 2018 where cards are accepted most places OR at least be a little nicer about referring me to an ATM. Really left my night in a bad mood. Not good vibes! Sorry I was such an inconvenience to you.
author: Spencer S.

description: Best Taqueria to get a burrito from.. I've been coming here for YEARS and regardless of how long the line is, I do not mind waiting because the food is definitely worth it
author: Ernesto C.

description: Stars based on El Farolito as a whole! The food is 5 Star for their suizas. The ceviche is a little too moist and salty for me, also they don't include mayonnaise. The bathroom is always filthy, even unable to use. If you go past 9pm please expect a couple drunk people and a long line. Super suizas are worth it! Open late, but cash only.
author: Danielle S.

description: Definitely where I head every trip before I fly out of SF. Super Shrimp burrito is what I crave when I'm in town. Haven't tried everything but I'm true to what I love!
author: Isis A.

description: This place is the Jim's Steaks of Mission District. My Philly people will understand.
author: Nick B.

description:
I've eaten at this place on a few accounts. 

1.) Came after getting drunk and dancing with the Bboys. Yum (cock fest)
2.) Nothing else was open so this was our best option after dancing,again.
3.) After helping a friend move into her spot in SF, needed to recharge 

So one thing for sure the spot is super narrow and it feels a little tight. I use to be a big avid burrito eater but then I looked in the mirror and realized that's why I was still single and lonely.
So my go to's now are quesadilla or tacos. 

My friend ordered a carne asada burrito and I believe I ordered a chicken quesadilla. The quesadilla wasn't bad, their tortilla was unique but their CHEESE was very tasty. I'm usually not a big advocate for cheese, but holy moly it was good.

Interestingly enough I invited these two young gentlemen to our table, cause it was quite crowded. One of them ordered a beef head taco. Now I've heard people call it Cabeza, some call it barbacoa.

Alright, you guys need to make up your damn mind.

Anyways I was introduced to that (meat) from our new Canadian Friend it looked really delicious. So I went back on another night while going to a birthday event at Urban Putt, and ordered one. 

Yea, it was very delicious. In my opinion if you're gonna go get anything from El Farolito, Beef head taco. Game over. 

Not good for dates.
author: Huy H.

description:
I know my friend is going to kill me for saying it - but I thought this was just OK. Cheap for huge portions most definitely. But just too damn greasy and sloppy. I get that might be some people's vibe but it just isn't mine. 

I had a carnitas toastada and a carne taco. Nothing really stood out to me other than they were sloppy and greasy. The flavors were just ok.
author: Andrew B.

description:
After ages I finally got to try out el farolito. Anyone can tell you that I'm the biggest fan of tacos, so I've been eyeing el farolito forever now! 

The staff are super nice and accommodating. We also got a free side of chips. All their salsas are also super delicious!

If you read any of my other taco reviews you'll notice that I always order tripe tacos cos they're my absolute fav tacos in the world as gross as that sounds. But they didn't have tripe when I came :( however, that forced me to try new things, like their popular carne asada tacos and lengua tacos. I also ordered a ceviche tostada.

Carne asada tacos (5/5)
I never order carne asada tacos cos I think they're hella basic. But I decided to give this a try since there were so many reviews about it and it was really good! There were were crispy pieces and a great smokey flavor to the meat! Very pleased.

Lengua tacos (4/5)
El farolito gives you huge chunks of lengua. My only complaint is that it didn't have a lot of seasoning or flavor, but overall not bad either, just nothing special.

Ceviche tostada (4/5)
I love ceviche!!! And the ceviche tostada here is no exception. It is a shrimp ceviche with tomatoes and is more on the sweeter side, but absolutely delicious! The only reason why it doesn't get 5/5 for me is because the tostada gets pretty soggy. I think this dish would be much better as an individual cup of ceviche and served with chips on the side.

If I'm ever in the mission, this is definitely going to be my choice restaurant!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
I grew up on the super burrito carne asada. THIS IS THE BEST BURRITO IN THE WORLD.
I travel back to California from Texas just to have my burrito from El Farolitos.
It's not the healthiest thing in the world but it is so good it's like eating dessert for dinner, you will love it!
author: Marcus S.

description:
Growing up in Southern California, I always had a bias towards Mexican food anywhere else. I think the best Mexican food is in L.A., hands down, but locals from San Diego and San Francisco would say otherwise.

That notion of L.A. being the king of Mexican food has been somewhat knocked down (for now) as I finally have been revisiting Farolito's more recently. I first visited this establishment many years ago, but unfortunately didn't get the burrito that currently is above the rest.

The "Super Shrimp and Meat" burrito which is about $12 and change, is a game changer. This burrito is not only the size of a half an infant, but the meat and thick, juicy pieces, of shrimp that's tucked inside, just waits for you to release it onto to your mouth and taste buds.

Get some of the roja and verde in the salsa bar and call it a day. They also serve alcohol here, so, if you want a beer to go with your baby burrito, then, by all means. Place is cash only and parking can be a chore, but worth the scavanging for parking and waiting in the sometimes long line for the wares.
author: Wes S.

description: I don't specifically remember what I ordered from here. All I remember was that it was a nightmare and an annoying experience. CASH ONLY. Seating areas are filthy. Restaurant is so small that every time someone walks by me, they'll bump into my elbow. My boyfriend, his best friend, and I came here based off the great reviews on Yelp. It was kind of a disappointment. The food was okay. Just make sure if you order a burrito for here, have them place it on a plate for you. My boyfriend and his best friend both ordered a burrito and the employees threw it in one of those red oval plastic containers. I asked for two plastic plates for the guys and one of the employee decided to hand me a styrofoam plate like the knife won't cut through!? The burrito eventually broke apart so it'll be a lot easier if you get it on a plate so that you can use a fork and a knife if needed.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Finally got to try it!! I was really excited for some El Farolito when I visited SF. It just seemed like such delicious drunk food. And I'm sure it is, but I wasn't even that drunk anymore when I got here. It was around 1AM or so and the line was out the door... apparently that's typical so good for you El Farolito.

My friend suggested the shrimp & steak burrito, and I asked for NO BEANS.... but got some anyway. BOO. If there were no beans, it might have been a LOT better. I don't like beans lol (with exceptions of course). 

But honestly it was still delicious. I forgot which salsas I got, but I liked the spicy one... as always. Dump some on your burrito and mMMMMMM. The shrimps were surprisingly huge and plump with a nice bite to em. I've only had one other shrimp burrito before lol and maybe I should be hitting those more often! The steak wasn't even necessary I thought lol. Delicious overall though.

Also.... you can probably share lol. It's a huge ass burrito, and I think it cost like 12 something bucks! Maybe that's because it's steak and shrimp (the fancier meats oOoO), but in SoCal that seems a little overpriced. I mean.. totally worth it for the size, but I can't finish it lol.

BOMB (drunk or regular) food for sure. Would come back. Hopefully be drunker next time so I can enjoy my burrito in all its glorious .... glory.
author: Fran B.

description:
Everyone recommended it as the one burrito place we must check out when visiting SF since the food is as close to Southern Cali food that you'd get in SF. I was not the least bit disappointed. I ordered a lot (got the nachos with egg and a burrito). I don't love their corn tortilla chips so I skipped the nachos the next time I went and focused on the burrito. I got the carne asada based on recommendations here and it was amazing. I'm sure any of the steak dishes would be good but I thoroughly enjoyed the burrito.

Tl;dr:
+ *Cash only* !!
+ Steak is amazing (burrito is a good choice)
+ Corn tortilla chips
+ They have Corona
author: Neechi M.

description:
Oh my gosh. Being from SoCal living near LA, there are so many delicious taco joints that I was pretty skeptical when my girlfriend pointed out that this was the best taco joint. However, I am now a full fledged believer! 

The tacos from here are on the pricier side, roughly 3 bucks each, however they are stuffed to the brim with meet cilantro and onions. 3 tacos will do most people well and fill them up. We got the carne Asada and carnitas. Both meats we're cooked perfectly and honestly, didn't even need to be eaten with salsa. 

Yeah, they were that good.
author: Jason H.

description:
Wait a minute...I didn't review this place yet?!?!?!!

My go-to (but seriously everyone's go-to) mexican joint to get some BOMB burritos!!! I always get the carne asada super burrito (~$8)! It's got avocado, sour cream, beans, and some kinda sauce that really makes it awesome! There's always a line here, yes, even at 2 in the morning! But I've never had a problem getting a seat. You order up front and they give you a number. One time, a guy came in here with his guitar and started playing mariachi music trolling for tips, it was quite a performance.

Maybe I'll be a little more adventurous next time and get a quesadilla? I know El Farolito with never disappoint! Anyways CASH ONLY.
author: Heidi L.

description:
wish this was across the street from my house, so yummmyyyy and affordable.
Usually a wait, but great portions and complimentary salsa, jalapeños,etc.
This is def a very casual, mom and pop, hole in the wall spot. So dont expect anything other than that.
Give it a try. CASH ONLY!
author: Stacy L.

description:
Great place for fast, casual, nor-cal stye Mexican food. I would recommend getting anything with shrimp (taco, burrito, quesadilla). The shrimp here always tastes fresh and mixes well with the other fresh ingredients.
If you have a big appetite I would recommend the shrimp and steak super burrito. 
Everything else on the menu is great to with the exception of the torta (mexican sandwich) you have to go somewhere else for that. 
This location is bigger and less crowded than the one on 24th and Mission. 
Salsa bar is a definite plus.
author: Antonio W.

description:
Ok...definitely the real deal. No nonsense fantastic burritos and tacos. Al pastor burrito was on fleek, great flour tortilla too. Al pastor had great flavor and was nicely charred as well. The salsas were really amazing too, better flavor than most for sure, especially the green one which may have a little avocado in it? It's got a great kick.

Place is hopping and hard to get a seat and line can be out the door, but it's worth it. Eat yourself silly for $10.
author: David L.

description:
As this is my first SF burrito experience, I am not an expert. But what I had, I enjoyed; what I couldn't finish, I regretted. The burritos here are insanely large. YUUUGE. So large that I think it would suffice to buy their super burrito and finish it in two sittings. Very cost effective!

The lineup is long, the wait is a while, but the burrito is worth it. Try their Super Burrito and keep everything in it. The rice, avocado, and beans taste amazing in the sour cream. The pita bread wrapping is tight and delicious. There's a few interesting options for the choice of meat, but I didn't particularly enjoy the deep fried pork. Maybe get the marinated pork in the future?

The decor is sketchy and dirty, and the areas not the best, but if you're just here for a burrito, you're probably gonna be fine.
author: Ben Z.

description:
The. best. lengua. taco I've ever had!

Tacos are simple, but the simplest foods are the most difficult to master. Every ingredient holds a little more weight in the finished product. The lengua here was juicy, fresh, tender, and also generous for a $3 taco.

Also got the tripas, which I didn't expect to be fried chitterlings. Would probably not do this one again, since it's kinda hard and chewy at different spots. Maybe that's how it's supposed to be though, so I'm not docking points. Also tasted fresh too.

Even their corn tortillas were soft but firm (huh?).. Ok, I mean it's heated to perfection soft, and held together, didn't fall apart at all when I was eating it.

I'm coming for you again El Farolito!
author: Maggie G.

description:
Came here on a saturday night with my boyfriend. We both got the super burrito; mine with carne asada and his with chicken.

Pros:
- HUGE burritos! I could only eat a little less than half of mine, and ended up saving the other half for lunch the next day (it was still really good the next day!). My boyfriend ended up eating his entire burrito... don't know how he does it... It was seriously bigger than my head!
- Great customer turnaround. No bs. No chit chat. They were just churning out order after order. Those guys work hard and they got us in and out in no time.
- Pricing. You seriously get bang for your buck here. They use huge ass tortillas and pack as much as they can inside it.

Cons:
- The wait? But it's to be expected. This is a community gem so there's going to be a crowd, so just prepare yourself for that. But once you get in line, it really doesn't take too long.
author: Michiru K.

description: Waited over 45 mins. Really disappointed couilda just gotten taco bell instead. Food was bland line was long I don't get get it
author: Kumar S.

description:
THIS PLACE IS THE BOMBBBBBBBBBB. 
Their burritos are huge and their portions are HUGE! SUPER NACHOS ARE HUGE! SUPER QUESADILLAS ARE HUGE! CARNE ASADA EVERYTHING PLZZZ! Their carne asada is soooooo tender and flavorful. This is one of the best Mexican places I have ever gone to, and this is still one of my favorites! Such good, good, GOOOD flavorFULLL food. Such big, big, BIG portions. I can't explain. It's amazing. 

The area may look a bit sketchy at night, but if you can get over that, you'll see what greatness El Farolito holds! This place is a bit small, so sometimes it may be a bit frustrating trying to walk back and forth, but the food is so good, I don't even mind. BTW this place is cash only, so make sure you have some cash on hand, or else you'll have no other choice but to use the ATM machine outside next to the dirty club...
author: Jane N.

description:
Favorite Mission-style burrito.

Others come close, but El Farolito is where it's at. There's almost always a line and of course it's cash only. These super burritos are loaded so be prepared to either be satisfactorily full with eating 1/2 or nearing stuffed with eating a whole one. What puts these super burritos apart from others is the ratio of fillings and the juiciness of the meat. Every bite is flavorful and you can even choose to get a spinach or wheat tortilla if you want to be "healthier".

This is definitely my go-to spot for out of town friends looking to try the all famous Mission-style burrito. And while the location is convenient, it's also pretty grunge-y as it's right next to Bart and the inside can be a tad questionable... But the majority of the taquerias in the area a like that.
author: Liza X.

description: Got a veggie burrito on my way out of the city and it was fire! Like literally cuz they're salsa is spicy af but so yum! Would totally come back!
author: Ashley J.

description: The burritos are massive and absolutely delicious. They were out of a couple of the meats when I was there but El pastor was delicious.
author: Aden S.

description: Amazing food. We are for Los Angeles, but this place has the best burritos we have ever had. Do not get it mixed up with El Faro which is another place in SF. Make sure to take CASH since it is a cash only place. You will not regret it.
author: Sevan H.

description:
The best mission super burrito in the world. That's an understatement really, but I have no other words to describe it.

Well maybe a few.. 

Incredible value, quality, and best of all, it's always consistent. Don't let the long lines or lack of seating scare you away. A) the line moves quick B) make new friends and ask people if you can sit with them. 

You can't go wrong with any of their meat options. Go for the green sauce from the salsa bar. Tip well, these are the best cooks, servers, busboys, staff in general in San Francisco.
author: Noky C.

description: I had the best burrito I've ever had at El Farolito. We shared the carne asada super burritto along with a beef head taco. The beef head in the taco was soft and tender; the texture was very similar to a oyster. The corn tortilla had outstanding consistency. The crispiness of the burrito's flour tortillas stood out to me the most. The contents of the burrito were in perfect balance. All quality ingredients that were cooked right and served fresh.
author: Joseph T.

description:
I feel like this is one of the few places in SF you can go and get a dinner for under $10, and on top of that, the burritos are so huge that you can eat the other half the next day.

I've tried the burritos and the quesadilla suiza here, and every combination I've had has been amazing. The meat is flavored well (I recommend the carne asada!) and they pile on a perfect combination of rice, beans, cheese and avocado. Although the line can be long at times, it moves quickly and it is so worth it.

Cash only, but there are plenty of banks in the area.
author: Laura D.

description:
They have a solid huge burrito. I find La Taqueria to be better IMO so I probably wouldn't ever come back. I'm not a fan of rice inside my burrito either. What a waste of space. 

The place is so dirty filthy gross too. It sure looks like the health department hasn't come by lately for inspection.

It's pretty great they are open until 3am on weekends. It seems to be where all the drunk people go after the bars close.
author: Jen B.

description: Historic place for the Mission! From all the Farolitos this is the best one! Always full of people but lines moves fast!
author: Cardenas M.

description:
I was ecstatic to be able to try out this taqueria but was highly let down. We arrived after what should have been the lunch rush and it was still packed. The inside is TINY. You're squished the entire time that you are in there and good luck finding a table. 

My order was the Carne Asada Quesadilla Suiza. I guess the Super Suiza is the way to go because all I received was a tiny soggy quesadilla with one thin piece of carne asada covering the inside. The meat was extremely flavorless. I'm not sure if the sogginess was due to me taking it to-go but they should package it differently if so. It took a long time to get our food as well. The plus side is that the salsas were delicious.
author: Morgan H.

description:
When asked to name my favorite Mexican spot in San Francisco, I've always very quickly made it clear that the tacos at Street Taco (https://www.yelp.com/biz/street-taco-san-francisco) can't be beat; and two times out of three i'm wrong on account of El Farolito existing. After putting El Farolito to the test I still think that Street Taco comes out on top, but when it comes to late night Mexican food when in a state of questionable sobriety El Farolito truly cannot be topped. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

While it may not look like as much, El Farolito is an exceptionally well oiled machine, and even the longest of unruly lines can be tamed and churned through in far less time than you'd think. It's important to keep in mind that El Farolito is cash only, and you'd better know what you want long before a menu is even visible. Place your order, pay, take a number, and listen carefully hombre - the system works if you play the game. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

The value at El Farolito is unbelievable, and for under $7.00 you can score a burrito that surpasses the size of your average chipotle burrito. Tacos and other items are priced accordingly. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

So here we go - as I unwrapped my carne asada super burrito a wave of hype washed over me, and turmoil over whether or not my favorite Street Taco would be surpassed washed over me. 

The turmoil didn't last long, but there's still some good competition here. The meats at El Farolito are flavorful, and they go together nicely with the beans, rice, and very generous portions of sour cream wrapped in a flavorful tortilla. Was this the best burrito I'd ever had? No, the ingredients were distinctly segmented and the sour cream more or less took over half the burrito, but it was filled with good flavor. Single Star Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

So Street Taco retains the crown as my favorite Mexican spot in San Francisco, but El Farolito deserves all of the hype that it gets with the late night Mexican market overwhelmingly secured thanks to quality and valuable offerings. Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description: Had to check it out after hearing from so many friends. Drove for 2 hours on Friday evening for cash only and dragged my hubby along to give him a taste of local sfo.... absolutely worth it!!!
author: Shailja S.

description: The Line out the door was the first indicator I was in for a treat. I got the super burrito with carne and it was delicious I ate the whole thing. The inside of the place isn't the most charming or the cleanest but the food was SO good and the chips were only $.69.
author: Conor S.

description:
Over Rated Burrito- Lacks Flavor in The Meats

I ordered the top burrito (the Boss) here and wife order the Chile relleno plate. The burrito I ordered was claimed to be top ranked for burritos. Here's what I found ordering the featured most expensive burrito consisting of shrimp and pork meat with usual fillers beans and rice. The meats, when examined individually, were very lacking in flavor; the shrimp and the pork meat namely. This meat needs to be marinated to be deemed the top burrito. They were bland and lacking salt at least. The beans and rice as far as I'm concerned, are nothing more than cheap filler items, though they did have good flavor in comparison. The Chile relleno plate was just average, a dish you can get at any Mexican restaurant with the same or better flavor.
author: Jerry L.

description:
Ordered the regular burrito with carne. Added a can of Pepsi for roughly $10. Plenty of booths for parties of 2-4. Friendly staff! They deliver the meal to your table and constantly clean the dining area for their customer.

Their salsa caught me off guard because I can't spicy AT ALL. Customers started starring at me when I unfolded my burrito and ate everything except the salsa. 

Would I come again? Sure
author: Danae L.

description:
Al pastor super burrito is the best!!!
Sometimes it has a long line, but it moves pretty quick!
The parking is hard to find sometimes, but I don't mind picking it up for to go.
author: Candice L.

description: Super burrito is a must try. I got the chicken super burrito and it was huge! There was so much meat and sauce inside the burrito! I couldn't even finish it. I'm legit serious, this burrito is huge. I had to save it for a snack after a couple of hours of digestion. Seriously, this burrito is huge, filling and delicious! I'm coming back here the next time I'm in the Mission!
author: Brenda C.

description: One of my favorite places in the Mission to get a juicy, meat packed, hefty burrito for less than $8. Remember it's cash only though! I would come during off peak hours to avoid the lines but normally goes pretty fast regardless. I usually get al pastor but the chicken is also great. You can't really go wrong here.
author: Lucy G.

description:
This review is about 10 years overdue.

Lines are long, food is worth the wait.

Mexican food, Jalisco style. Let me assure you, your mauf will break. The food is like crack. You'll want more, even when you're not hungry anymore. It's that good.

The green salsa, peppered with tiny avocado bits is the business.

The veggie nachos are where it's at. My fave, and trust me, I've tried every taqueria in the Mission.

Don't even look at the menu, just order the nachos. 

When a Mexican commands you to order the nachos, you shouldn't question it. 

Do it.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
In. Love.

Was going to get Mexican food for dinner one night, so the family went here to pick up some food. I haven't been here before, so Yelp was a great resource (). I ordered the carne asada super quesadilla suiza! First off I didn't expect a rectangular quesadilla. It comes in four large pieces! You can actually eat this for two meals. The super (I don't know what the regular version contains) contains carne asada, sour cream, AVOCADO, & cheese! So so good. Others got the burrito and it was pretty big as well! The nachos are very good too. I've never seen a Mexican restaurant separate the nachos and toppings! Props to that.

Whenever I'm in the bay and craving Mexican food, this will definitely be my #1 spot!
author: Christina L.

description:
Taste: great! You can ask for less rice if you want. Interesting combo is chimp and steak! Cooked right in front of you!
Price: perfect I was full for day!
Service: they are always busy serve with a smile but can get confused with who ordered what do to the chaos! 
Bathrooms: male urinal and female toilet in one bathroom. Kinda gross. But I guess all men's bathrooms are gross.
author: Heba E.

description:
I've been exploring around San Francisco since I started attending school at SFSU and I decided to stop by here to get my Mexican food craving satisfied. Yes, the food is good but it tasted about average to me. I got the super burrito, my boyfriend ordered the nachos. Our usual place to get Mexican food is in Hayward at a place called Chavez, and Chavez has never failed to disappoint me.

After getting the super burrito at El Farolito, I felt a bit disappointed because I expected it to be a lot better. After taking my first bite, I realized I just ate tortilla, sour cream, and a little bit of rice. I couldn't get to the meat until a few bites in.  I got lengua with my super burrito, I appreciated that some of the meat was tender and soft and as if it would melt in your mouth, but there were some pieces of meat that were the opposite and almost had the texture and quality of Carne asada. I'm not sure if the meats mixed or if the meat was cooked slightly unevenly. My boyfriend who ordered the nachos, usually orders that as well as Chavez and I was surprised at the amount of chips they gave him. Both of us thought there would be more nachos, but it was pretty empty.. you could see the bottom of the box. At Chavez they usually overflow it with chips, meat, and lots of salsa and guac. I guess it depends where you go or what you expect. 

I sadly don't see myself coming back here because it's not as satisfying as Chavez in Hayward (or that satisfying in general), but I'll definitely keep looking around more in SF to where I can grab myself a delicious and well-proportioned super burrito.
author: Mae-Elisa S.

description: Exceptional Mission-style burritos and Mexican food. The whole pickled jalapeños in the salsa are delicious as well. It's always busy, get in line, worth the wait!
author: David S.

description:
ERGH this place is so good, and even more so when you have been deprived burritos al pastor in DC!

FOOD - Who can complain about an $8 super burrito with meat? No one! Not only am I happy, but I am stuffed. The tacos are good too, but really ride the burrito train.

SPACE - It's more spacious than it looks from the door. The cleanliness can be improved but it's so packed that you'll steal any table you can and bus it yourself. Not a bad thing as we are human but don't be surprised.

Thank you, El Farolito for the delicious burrito! :)
author: Connie H.

description:
Best burrito of my life. Get the carne asada super burrito. It is tasty with perfectly cooked steak. This place isn't much to look at when you walk in, but what it lacks in ambiance it more than makes up for in taste. This thing is huge! Definitely two meals worth, or in my case, one meal and I didn't eat again until breakfast the next day.

Visit El Farolito when you're in the Mission District in San Francisco. It's right off the 24th/Mission BART stop. Super convenient.
author: Sara W.

description:
Gave a quick call to inquire about if they use lard or not due to a dietary restriction. The employee said no and I asked if they used vegetarian oil and then he hung up. Now they won't answer my calls which is very strange....

Looks like from the reviews they do use lard so I'm not sure why they would lie?
author: Simal A.

description:
Another highly recommended place from my friends. It was decent. Not amazing as everyone said it would be. The service was very fast and loud (you'll understand when you get there). Perhaps it was because we had just had appetizers from an upscale restaurant that made the contrast so drastic but none-the-less this place was definitely popping, from live music to countless amount of locals here. It was located in one of the shadiest neighborhoods we had been to.

We ordered a super burrito with steak. That thing was pretty diesel. I only ordered two tacos and even that was pretty huge. We had to take our food to go after trying to eat it for an hour. I won't argue, this place is totally bang for buck.

Would I recommend this place to my friends? Yes! I'd like to come back at a time where I am also hungry to make it a fair playing field for this place. :)
author: Yuena L.

description:
Whoa, best quesadilla I've ever had. Hands down. First it was huge, two can definitely split for lunch. Perfect carne asada and tortilla. So  good- looked better than the burrito my friend got. Cheap beer and quick service, will definitely come here again. 

Cash only but there's a sketchy atm on the wall outside
author: Micah R.

description: Absolutely the best authentic Mexican food I've had in "The City". If you think you know better, please edumacate me!
author: Cuervo R.

description:
Get the super burrito for only $1 more than the regular. My husband liked my chicken more than his carnitas burrito but you can't go wrong either way.

The chicken is super flavorful and plentiful. There's hardly any rice (filler) but the star is the burrito wrap. It has amazing elasticity, it's chewy, & it didn't break at any point of my meal. I was so impressed at how it stayed together.

The guac, salsa, and pico de gallo is self service. The guac is pretty spicy and the pico was super on point. 

Don't try to eat the whole burrito baby in one sitting like I did. I'm still full the next day. They have tinfoil on the counters so you can wrap up leftovers for later..
author: Jenny K. L.

description:
After following fivethirtyeight's burrito bracket, El Farolito got added to my to-eat list by virtue of having the highest VORB (Value Over Replacement Burrito) in the land.  I made it over to this location on Christmas Eve and luckily they were open.  We were there for an early-ish (11:30) lunch and there wasn't any line, though more people were coming in as we were finishing up.

El Farolito's reputation is well deserved.  The burritos were amazing.  I had half of a super al pastor burrito.  The seasoning was tasty, and the meat and fillings were delicious.  The burritos were huge and cheap.  Half was plenty for lunch for me, and I split it with my girlfriend, who enjoyed it enough to risk food poisoning by finishing her leftovers after walking around with them all afternoon (eep...).  We also got an order of chips to take advantage of the salsa bar.  The salsas were good, but the burritos are definitely the highlight here.
author: Bryce A.

description:
My favorite Mexican food restaurant in the mission!!

We came around 5:30 pm on a Tuesday evening and the line was not long at all and the service was quick! Super quesadilla with carne asada definitely hit the spot for dinner tonight!
author: Michele W.

description: When my friends brought here in the of SF's seedy Mission District after the Cal Berkeley game close to midnight, I thought they were crazy. It turned out to be a fun gastronomic adventure. The outside was dark but strangely inviting. There was a long line of hungry and/or curious patrons. The window/counter gave you a peek of inter workings of this taqueria; masterpieces of culinary delights were being assembled. The cafe manager/cashier was loudly barking out order numbers that were ready to be picked! Eager customers were peering at the greasy menus boards and making critical choices with the cashier. The separation between the incoming customers and the seated patrons was very narrow; definitely not for those who suffering from any form of claustrophobia! The reward for those choosing to dine in and who were lucky to find seating was to have your order number called out in an unexpectedly quick wait! Presentation was very minimal but the food that my friends and ordered (assorted burritos and a quesadilla) were larger  and spicier than expected and very satisfying!  This may not be the cleanest nor safest place you visit in the middle of the night in the Mission District but this authentic Mission Style food at it's best!!
author: Hiron J.

description:
El Foralito, Mission night scene this be the crack spot
where hot chicks come through with Salsa, Pollo ven hot/
dirty dirty legitimacy with Pastor and Tongue delicacy,
side of midnight munchies and get-rich conspiracies/
buzz to a buddy, talk with a fly,
grimy tables is but a matter of mind/
Drunk or sober, high like oragami plane
your wish for a tortilla to fold One Thousand Cranes/
make one hundred similes,
or just one metaphor.
burrito not a bag for the poor,
rich meat so juicy, call that Tasty Couture/
Mami holler at cops
hipsters hit it and pop
one bite is all to work it and charm
let go the Bell and sound the alarm/
Put the Taco Bell back on the pause
I'm talking El Foralito. This is Live Mas.

foodkid fAAtcity
author: Ringo M.

description:
AW MAN. I hate it when my review gets lost in a sea of thousands. Basically I am writing this for my own satisfaction. 

I JUST moved to San Francisco, this was my first official meal here. We came for lunch on a Saturday and, of course, there was a line. But it moves at a reasonable pace so don't you worry. You know when you spend years hearing things like, "Mexican food outside of Mexico and California sucks" And you're like no, but there are so many great places in city X and town Y that are amazing it can't be THAT true. 

Yeah, it's just freakin' true. The best tacos I've ever had and they were my first ones here. First of all, for two fitty a taco you get portions equivalent to TWO tacos on the east coast. I tried one marinated pork and one steak. They were so juicy, it spilled all over my basket. Every bite is bursting with that Mexican flavor we love, a bit of cilantro and onion and all that tender chopped meat. Also, the salsa and jalapeno bar. Why has this not caught on in the rest of the country? It's FRESH and actually HOT. Not accommodating and unapologetic to anyone who can't handle heat. 

My partner ordered the carne asada plate which he LOVED. The beef was thinly sliced and amazing. They also have a little side of seared scallions, such a nice touch. 

I promise I'l be back here when I'm schwasted and also when every east coaster comes this way to visit me! 

El Farolito, you will forever be the one who introduced me to the Mexican food I've been missing all my life.
author: Priti K.

description: This place is waaaaaayyyyy overrated! Most people who move or travel to San Francisco don't know what good Mexican actually tastes like, so they come to this place n think it's good when in fact it's not that good. It was good 25yrs ago when I use to come here to eat after school.
author: G G.

description:
El is for the way you look at me
Far is for how far I'd go for you
O is for the only food I see
Lito is not the way I'd describe the burritos

Okay, so my rhyming skills are a bit off... but hello, delicious El Farolito burritos! When people raved about this place, I thought it was all hype. Boy, was I wrong!

El Farolito has around 9 locations around the bay, but this one is the original. Thank goodness it's located right next to the BART station, cause I'm a pansy when it comes to sketchy neighborhoods. 

The restaurant ain't the cleanest... but like Vietnamese restaurants, the dirtier the restaurant, the better the food! With burritos, quesadillas, tacos, nachos, and more to choose from... I had to try their famous super burritos. The carne asada mixed with rice, sour cream, guacamole, and cheese wrapped together made me almost tear up from happiness. I was only able to finish half of my burrito and was stuffed!

Everyone wrote about how they come here to satisfy their drunchies. This is definitely on my list of things to do. :)

Chipotle, we need to talk. This isn't working out between us...
author: Christine S.

description: Still love this place so much, have been here at least 20 times in the last few years. The carnitas super burrito holds a special place in my heart.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
I'm here on vacation to visit friends, and this came highly recommended. I ordered the el pastor burrito. I had middle-of-the-road expectations because a burrito is a burrito is a burrito...like tacos. 

Food is made to order so you'll be waiting a bit, in addition to the wait in line. The line was about 8 people and it took about 15 minutes for me to get my order in. There is very little space to wait so you're crowded with the people in line and those waiting for their food. They have a 2-salsa bar where you can help yourself to sauces to go. 

Got the burrito home. When I opened it, it was larger and heavier than I thought it would be. I took a large bite...I was whisked away into a burrito heaven that I never knew existed. Hands down best burrito I've ever had. The meat was marinated and flavorful. You could taste the spices in your mouth mixing with the rice and beans. It was soooo good! It was a simple burrito with big flavor. I highly recommend, just like the other few thousand reviewers.
author: Sylvia C.

description: Wow.  Incredible super burrito.  Saw that they are ranked on numerous sites as one of the top burritos in the country and decided to give it a try.   Was not disappointed.   The carne asada super burrito was huge and had meat rice beans cheese avocado pico de gallo and sour cream. For a little over $8 this burrito was on point and definitely a meal.   Salsa bar had a green sauce with some decent heat.  Also tried the carne asada torta and it did not disappoint either.  If you are adventurous  try the El Farolito bar next door.  Better know your soccer and don't try to order coors light
author: Eric E.

description:
Not very nice inside, but good Mexican food~
We had a Carne Asada and Al Pastor burritos.
So full, can't finish.
author: Serena O.

description:
Why has this review taken so long. Probably because I don't really recall waiting in line with loads of drunk people at 1am on a weekend night. This time as a newly minted mature adult I decided to swing by at 11pm on a rainy weekday as I needed to grab a bite on the way home.

It was like they had reserved the whole restaurant for me. The old, real Mission that I grew up in (and was scared of). Without the hoards of techies and Yelpers like myself. Granted, I was there. Boo-ya. I'm different haha.

Anyways, let's be real, you can get tacos and burritos that are on par and even in some cases better. I come here for the quesadilla. Whether it's the suiza or para dos ... GET THE QUESADILLA. WITH THE PASTOR.

As much as I love sour cream, I actually prefer it on the side so the heat and cold don't mix and sit there. Dip the sour cream and green sauce for the quesadilla and you'll see what the greatness is all about. Just try and avoid the "busier" hours of post drinking food munchies.

Gracias!
author: Joseph L.

description:
Had an amazing quesadilla with al pastor!!!!
So tasty... Probably one of the best ones since being in San Francisco (about 4 years now).
This place had a legitimate taste and you could see that the other people eating were definitely into the food for sure. 

Will be returning back probably get a burrito because those looked really tasty as well.
author: Barry K.

description:
El Farolito offers the best value food in SF. I got an burrito and beef tongue taco for 11 dollars. The meat is very fresh and beef tongue is very tender. The 65 cent chips have strong corn flavor. 

If you can't eat spicy food, make sure to tell the cashier because the beef tongue tach are very spicy.
author: Tianyi L.

description:
My sister and I shared their super nachos (nachos topped with cheese, sour cream, refried beans, jalapeños, avocados, and carne asada), an al pastor taco, a carnitas taco, and a fresca. Tacos were huge and the nachos were really good! They are definitely generous with their portions.  They also had a help yourself bar with different sauces and salsa. I just wish they had Super French fries!! 

The location we went to is open late until 2:30am, has a good amount of seating and is a little on the dirty side. I would def come back to try their beef and shrimp super burrito!
author: Linz C.

description:
I love tacos. I love late night taco joints. I love El Farolito. Their tacos are warm and piping, their salsa is fresh and acidic, and it's a good price for your wallet.

The only downside: it gets crowded so the line gets long and there aren't too many places to sit. Also, make sure you bring cash! There's an ATM outside but they do charge you.
author: Jessie Y.

description: This is one of the best tacos I've ever had!! I ordered two tacos (marinated pork and chicken) and I already knew it would be awesome when I opened it. And yes I was right!! That first bite made me really happy because all the flavors were just bursting out and it was just reallyyyyy delicious. I absolutely loved this place. I highly recommend it to everyone, do not miss out!
author: Priscilla C.

description:
I loooooove El Farolito.  Been here a couple of times and it still hasn't disappointed me.  If you have a SoCal resident say that this was the best Mexican food he's tasted so far in SF, then you know this is the truth. I always order my three Al Pastor tacos, made authentic with onions and cilantro.  Don't forget the mild, medium or hot salsa.  Taco meat is made right on the grill in front of you. They also give you complimentary chips and salsa to much on while waiting for your food.

When the order came out I remembered I should have ordered two tacos instead of three, because the tacos were packed with meat!  Every bite is filled with the juiciness and flavor of the meat on fresh hot tortillas, while the salsa packs heat. 

This has become my must-go-to place while in SF. So far, everyone I've introduced El Farolito to has
author: Amanda D.

description: Drunk or planning to get drunk? This is your place. The best Mission Mexican food in my opinion and I was born & raised in the Bay. We came back 4 times in the 6 days we were in town (no longer live here), seriously no joke. It also probably helps that it is open super late. I swear there is no where else you can get two HUGE soft tacos for 6.50 (before tax) and be stuffed...happy & content. We had soft & hard tacos (the hard was my fav!) and the super burrito throughout our visits. Seriously, my hangovers were almost nil to zero after grabbing food here late night. The green avocado salsa is spicy but absolutely, perfectly freaking a must for any of their menu items. Pollo, pollo, pollo is all I got to say. Bottom line: the only reason it has 4 stars is b/c they only accept cash. Can NOT wait to be back. I already miss this place.
author: Tina B.

description: Best tacos in the mission. Never disappoints! The only bad thing is their limited seating -_-
author: Adriana T.

description: This place is SOLID. Only catch is there's a chance of a super long line that goes out the door and it might take up to 20 mins to order. If there's one place to take a bunch of bros, this is it. Everything's hella inexpensive and actually be careful if you're gonna bar hop through the mission after cause you might be too stuffed.
author: Dion L.

description: Authentic Mexican food. We ordered vegetarian nachos, quesidillas and burrito- all were great and their sauces were spicy - just the way we liked. Highly recommended
author: Annabelle G.

description: This place is awesome for your late night Mexican food cravings. The burritos are hugeeee and so yummy, as well as the tacos. Its conveniently located near all the bars and events in mission, and its near one of the mission bart stations so its pretty easy to reach!
author: Larissa L.

description: You know it's a good taqueria when people come here sober and the line goes out the door all times of the day. I like it for its proximity to the bart station. This little joint offers the best carne asada super burrito. It was so big that I had to split it with my friend. The homemade salsas were amazing. My mouth was watering while I was waiting to order. 10/10 would come again when I visit sf
author: Randy L.

description:
Best burrito I've ever tasted! Meat is excellent and the ingredients must be fresh given how many customers they're serving every day. Staff are friendly and quick, once I placed my order I waited less than 5 minutes to get my Carne Asada Super Burrito, which came to $8.70 after tax. There's some space indoors to enjoy your burrito but you could try to find seats outside as well. 

Absolutely a must-visit burrito place in SF!!!
author: Dian J.

description:
I lived in San Diego for 4 years and thought I knew what good Mexican food was. I simply must have not been going to the right places (with the exception of Tacos El Gordo in Chula Vista), because El Farolito literally changed how I feel about (Americanized?) Mexican food.

There are a few things I like in my Mexican food (and this will obviously betray how uneducated I am about this type of cuisine): flour tortillas, cheese, avocados, pork, and sour cream. It comes as no surprise, then, that the super suiza quesadilla was heaven for me. Most people like to order the default (carne asada), but if you're a fan of pork like me, get the al pastor. The meat was so perfectly tenderized and juicy and flavorful...I only wanted to take a couple of bites, but I ended up eating half of it. There was also so much sour cream and so many avocados that the quesadillas were practically watery by the time we got home--but the fried edges were still crispy and perfect. And like I said, I LOVE sour cream. They do not skimp on any of the toppings or meat here. 

There is also some sort of hot sauce in the quesadilla, which gives it a kick. There are also three other salsas you can pack yourself in the restaurant. I tried the green one (which numbed my mouth for 5 minutes) and the regular salsa. The non-salsa red one is super spicy, so I was too afraid to try it. But the spicy green sauce and the mild salsa both went great with the quesadilla.

My husband has been trying to cut back on meat so we had to get something vegetarian-friendly along with our super suiza quesadilla. We opted for the super nachos with fried eggs (you can also get it with your choice of meat) and I am so glad that we did. It's everything you'd expect with super nachos--refried beans, crispy fresh corn tortilla chips, avocados, jalapenos, tomatoes, sour cream, etc--but with 3 fried eggs on top. How utterly sinful. I can't believe we almost finished the whole thing, but it was irresistible.

Since I'm not a fan of corn or beans, I still prefer the super quesadilla over the super nachos, but I think regardless of what you your preferences are, you'll find El Farolito to be SUPER.

What's not super is the atmosphere. Not enough to drag this down to 4 stars, but the night we went a man who had just stolen some clothes (he was wearing the, tags still hanging out) ran out of the restaurant when a security guard popped up and grabbed some of the chips off customers' table while running by. So random. Even less random and less super was a crazy person running in, yelling, and then grabbing half of a poor girl's burrito before running out. The security guard was finally placed at the restaurant's entrance. He was in the middle of a verbal altercation with the clothing thief by the time my husband and I were leaving. Well, what can I say? Mission's deliciousness comes at a price.
author: Tiffany H.

description: The wait is worth it! Its not too bad a wait anyway, but we went at midnight on a Friday last summer. The chorizo and carne asada burrito were our picks. The tortilla is perfect -  not too thick and dense. Right balance of ingredients, not too much rice. So good!
author: Laurice S.

description: Food is good and it's a great hole in the wall find. Late night Mexican food cravings are definitely satisfied. Very divey and a authentic which can be fun. But standing in line outside is kind of intimidating late at night and even in the restaurant itself, at least as a girl. Staff can be kind of rude but they're just trying to get the line moving. The food comes out sooo quick which is a huge plus. The only thing is my tacos fell apart both times I came, the shell already extremely soggy, and my boyfriend's burrito completely broke in half and split open. It was almost impossible to eat. But overall worth going to to check it out yourself!
author: Arianna R.

description:
In the middle of the Mission District is an oasis. And it serves chips and salsa. While there are countless bars around the district, El Farolito is the area's main watering hole if you will and I promise you, it's not a mirage. El Farolito has 4 Yelp stars because it's affordable, the portions are large, and the food tastes amazing. 

Tip: Boba Guy's is right down the street and I'm in love with their balls. But they close their legs..doors..at 9 so keep that in mind.
author: Joshua F.

description:
How does Mexican food compare between LA and SF?  Is it the same?  Are there geographical differences in taste that affect the flavors and ingredients used?  I would argue that SF boasts better burritos while the tacos from LA rule supreme.

You will likely find the best SF burritos in the Mission district.  El Farolito is no exception to the rule.  Based on other reviews I ordered a breakfast burrito and also a taco al pastor.  I had heard the al pastor was in a class of its own, but I am a sucker for a breakfast burrito.

My taco al pastor, at $2.50, was huge, very filling.  Think two-three times larger than King Taco in LA.  The al pastor itself was succulent, just dripping with flavor, and perfectly accented by onions and cilantro.  The double corn tortillas somehow held together despite being overloaded with the pork.  Great!  5-star definitely.

My breakfast burrito was nearly a footlong, a beast of a burrito for only $6.75.  It included scrambled eggs, bacon, chorizo, rice, beans, sour cream, cheese and guacamole.  The bacon and chorizo were delicious, but with so many ingredients, it was a rather heterogenous meal depending on each bite.  I used plenty of hot sauce, but alas, could not finish the entire burrito having already eaten my taco.  4-star.

I think El Farolito continues the high standard of SF burritos.  The al pastor is certainly preferable over the breakfast burrito.  The "Bosses' Burrito" also caught my eye: shrimp and al pastor burrito, but at $13, seemed a bit pricey.  But maybe next time?
author: Gino I.

description: 1 of maybe 5 places in all of the east bay and city that serves up a quality burrito.  This place gives you a ritto the size of a fully grown Chihuahua.
author: Sam R.

description:
We were dying to try one of the 'mission' burritos everyone raves about in SF, and found this place on Yelp (of course). I admit, we were skeptical despite the reviews.... most things don't live up to the hype (see my reviews of the Hollywood Sign and Walk of Fame).  
This place was a long, narrow hole in the wall in a semi-rough area of town. There were homeless people everywhere and crazies wandering the streets. The place looked like it had been there for decades, was cash only, and they shouted order numbers in English and Spanish. You had to squeeze past a line of people to order and get to a table.  

Seemed promising. 

My wife ordered the beef burrito, and I had the carnitas burrito. I added on the Mexican coke in a bottle, and we were given tortilla chips while we waited.   This place had to be legit--mission style burritos on Mission Street of the Mission District of San Francisco, right? 

OMG YES! These burritos were nothing short of amazeballs. I'm a doubting Thomas turned believer. Meat, rice, beans, cheese, pico. That's all it takes for a mouth-watering, tortilla-wrapped bundle of goodness.   Did I mention they were HUGE? Think a venti starbucks cup wrapped in aluminum foil, and you're almost there. The cost? $7.00.

If you're ever in San Francisco, do yourself a favor and try this place out. It's well worth the trip.
author: Robbie G.

description:
Best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to! The food is beyond delicious and the service is great. They are so nice and they deliver food in such a reasonable time relative to how busy they are! I've been here 3 times already and can't wait to go back. I can't go to the mission without having al farolito!!! 

I didn't specify food because I've ordered different items and each one is better than the other! I recommend this place wholeheartedly :)
author: Revan N.

description:
I may or may not say yes to going out in the mission specifically in the hopes that I end up here. It cures all whether it's a hangover or a bad day. Didn't pick anyone up at the bar?  It's ok because the carne asada burrito will make you forget all about that. It pretty much saves lives. Originally I thought my obsession for the burrito here was because of the circumstances that led me here (post bar/ late night starving) but no. The burrito checks out at any time of day. 

The sheer size will fill you up, but the greasy awesomeness is what you are here for. It can't be replicated. This means a lot in an area with as many great taquerias as the mission. The super carne asada burrito with everything is my go-to. It's hard to describe, but you will understand my infatuation at first bite. To top it all off, the people who work here are also really cool and handle the stampede after last call very well. You may feel your stomach adjusting - but this is because you just stuffed your face with a burrito the size of a small child. And no regrets were had that day.
author: Thielson D.

description:
BEST Mexican joint in the United States of America.

Not even joking, it has been rated as top 10 Burrito at least on national lists.

CASH ONLY

They have a wide variety of meats- including tongue for those bold eaters- and everything is freshly grilled to order. The cheese is melted at the moment you ask for it and the chips come with a variety of sauce options. 

The line is always 20 minutes minimum and the joint is packed. You can find a table usually. 

This is the most authentic Mexican you will definitely find in SF. In addition to Pancho Villa.
author: Tara N.

description: The best burrito place in the city, in my opinion. The meat is spot on and the employees are always courteous. I've never had a bad experience.
author: Mika C.

description: Best Tacos, Burrito and Chips.One if my Favorite Taqueria.The Best!!
author: Ivan M.

description:
I can see and taste what all the hype is about this place.

Came on a Friday evening for dinner and the place was packed! I shared a super burrito with my boyfriend, along with super nachos. Both were so delicious and what I really liked was how quickly the food was prepared and came out (I was starving). This place gets the job done and it deserves the never ending amount of business that it gets.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Had lunch, used to go often until
I started going to another taco shop..

This place is good, not amazing.

Steak was dry, beans had a
wired texture...
author: Trey C.

description: This used to be my favorite burrito place in the mission. That was, until I moved into an apartment almost directly behind the restaurant. I now have intimate first hand knowledge of how they run their operations and the back of their "kitchen" which is really a parking lot. DI-SGUST-ING. It makes me want to vomit just thinking that I ever ate here. Heed this warning, the hype of this place does not include the exposure to completely unsanitary food handling conditions. They must be paying off the city inspectors because there is NO WAY this is legal. GROSS.
author: e w.

description: With over 4000 reviews, I figured it was worth a shot. It was awesome. The super burrito did not disappoint!
author: Mike B.

description: Best burrito  but super dirty. Honestly had second thought of even ordering food. But happy I did.
author: Jordyn B.

description:
3/5 Stars

EL FAROLITO EL GRANDE BURRITO
*CASH ONLY*

For cheap eats that will fill you up, this is a stop.  I went here with a bunch of friends after an afternoon at Dolores Park.  This place is just located a couple streets down from the park.

PROS
+Large Portions
+Affordable Prices, Very affordable for the size
+Quick Turn around time
+Bathrooms
+Inside Seating (parties of 4 or less per table
+Open Kitchen so you can see how fresh everything is cooked or made
+Salsa Bar

CONS
- Tortilla Chips are oily and not that great
-Dirty Restaurant
-Tight walkway; always bumping into people
-sketchy area at night
-all burritos or tacos taste pretty much the same
-workers don't really speak english too well

Overall, its a good pit stop if you are hungry.  I would rather just take it to-go and eat elsewhere!
author: Jordan Aaron C.

description:
Shout out to my girl Marilyn M. below for speaking so many truths about El Farolito. It comes in CLUTCH when you need a burrito. Open til 3:30 AM, need I say more? 

It's literally a hole in the wall, and you kind of question how sanitary things are, but bear with me - the food is great. My first time trying El Farolito was when I was on a high school field trip in 2008 (lol), and we came here after a long day of volunteering. Honestly, it set the bar pretty much for every single burrito I ate after. The burritos are super filling. I am ashamed to say I didn't finish it the first time I got it in junior year of high school, but it's okay - the many times I have been here after have made up for that first time. 

Drunk or sober - the food here will be satisfying. But get ready to run into the intoxicated. crowd if you come here late at night. The burritos are huge like I said - get ready to eat something like the size of a small child.
author: Steph V.

description:
Best damn taco place in town. LOVE LOVE LOVE this place El Faro is Bomb.com 

Awesome tacos, tons of meat, great burritos, ceviche, and the Torta is incredible delicious!  

I have dreams about the carnitas super suiza. The nachos are the size of your head x 2. 

Great place to eat amazing mexican. I try to go every time i'm in SF.
author: Elizabeth J.

description: Hanging around the mission a bit lately I kept walking past this location everytime I got off Bart. Well the other day my friend and I decided to grab dinner here before checking out a movie at the Alamo Drafthouse. The line was almost to the door and the place was bustling with people working and eating. I ordered the super burrito with steak. The wait was quite a bit long for this one. It took almost 15 minutes to get my food, but it was worth it. The burrito felt like a small baby I was holding. It was hefty and they did not skimp out on the meat and ingredients. It tasted fresh and I enjoyed every bite. The spot is in the mission, so this is definitely a more rough part of town. The place is a hole in the wall, so expect as much. Our table was clean overall and like I said I enjoyed it and would definitely stop by again if I'm in the area and want some Mexican food!
author: James R.

description:
A friend of my mine recommended El Farolito, as he recommended the tripe burrito. Sadly when we went for lunch that day, they didn't have any tripe.

So I settled for the carne asada burrito. It was very flavorful - the first bite tasted amazing. But it was way too greasy for me, and I had a very difficult time finishing the burrito. The juices and sauces from the ingredients made it also rather messy to eat.

Portions were large and well worth the price. Definitely worth a try if you are around the Mission area.
author: Alvin W.

description:
The best burrito I've ever had. *sigh

I think I had the al pastor carne in a "super" burrito.  

I could probably drink the salsas. 

Crave-worthy.
author: Lea L.

description: Some things don't live up to expectations. El Farolito was NOT ONE OF THEM. 5 stars all the way back to Monterrey. Olay!
author: Kirsten S.

description:
I recently had the best SF trip of my life and visiting El Farolito was one of the reasons.  This place is an absolute must try.  Located in the Mission district, this place is a total hole in the wall.  Don't expect nice and roomy seating.  Think more along the lines of waiting in a pretty long line, 30-40 minutes, in a single file line with a majority of the waiting being outside with the exception of a narrow corridor at the entrance.  Regardless of the long wait this place is absolutely amazing and totally worth it.  

I've been through my fair share of burritos but this place is easily top 3 burritos I have ever had.  I'm not even exaggerating, this place is that good.  I ordered a carne asada super burrito and it was definitely the way to go.  As you walk in you see one of the chefs cooking up a storm of various meats and with the lines this place has you know that the meat in your burrito will be freshly cooked.  The burrito comes with rice, beans, sour cream salsa, and literally a GIANT chopped up slice of avocado, and your choice of meat.  With a name like super burrito you would expect it to be huge and my expectations were met.  This thing was giant.  The food comes out relatively quickly, which is nice if you're starving.  They also have a salsa bar next to the cash register with 3 kinds of salsas.  

A few side notes, this place is cash only so be prepared, they have some seats inside, but can be difficult to find a table so have someone grab one while you wait in line, and as mentioned before be prepared to wait.  I seriously am looking forward to my next SF trip.
author: Jesus H.

description:
Delicious guac, sour cream, tender carne asada, cheese all in a huge quesadilla. That is the super suiza for you.  The hot sauce is what makes it. They have a green sauce which is probably made with magic. The portion is huge and you surely get the bang for your buck. I ate half the quesadilla and had one left for lunch the next day. This spot is close to bart and there is usually a line which makes it a staple for Mexican food in the Mission, but you can probably tell by many reviews already. You may even see a famous person in here. 
Don't forget to take hot sauce to go!
author: Jaime F.

description:
el farolito save my soul, it's a long way back to mexico
and i don't know if I'm ever gonna make it home.
you can sell whiskey to the indians
but ya can't sell records with lyrics that offend
the parents of rich, white, suburban youth,
you can wunk me on the head with a 2x4
you can burn down a liquor store,
but no one's gonna care in couple of years.
(rock guitar solo B)
viver esta perder lastimar. creo llamada enfermo manana,
soy enfermo del mundo y todo mi dinero comprar.
el farolito save my soul, it's a long way back to mexico,
and i dunno if i'm ever gonna make it home,
you can sell whiskey to the indians
you can play lotto till the summer ends,
but you'll never win.
author: Shane B.

description: *CASH ONLY* Let's be real here... leaving the bar at 2am starving, to find this gem is like heaven! Yes it's a heavy a** meal but who cares it's yummy and definitely  hits the spot!!!
author: Gia T.

description:
When an out of town guest asks about Mission burritos, my eyes light up and I launch into an explanation of how the burritos in Mission are unlike any they've had and that Chipotle burritos pale in comparison to the ones you'll find in Mission district. Usually my guests will tell me to calm down and stop breathing so fast.
